item.name: AB-75 Bo-Rifle
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls with this enhanced weapon. Additionally, while it is in staff mode, the save DC for its shocking property increases to 15.
{@i This version of the bo-rifle was exclusive to high-ranking members of the Honor Guard of Lasan.}

item.name: ARC caster
entries: Whenever you deal damage with this weapon and roll the maximum on the weapon damage die, the creature hit becomes shocked until the end of its next turn.

item.name: Absorbing Amplifier Mk I
entries: This item gains the absorbing 2 property. If it already has the absorbing property, its absorbing number increases by 2, to a maximum of 12.

item.name: Absorbing Amplifier Mk II
entries: This item gains the absorbing 4 property. If it already has the absorbing property, its absorbing number increases by 4, to a maximum of 12.

item.name: Absorbing Amplifier Mk III
entries: This item gains the absorbing 6 property. If it already has the absorbing property, its absorbing number increases by 6, to a maximum of 12.

item.name: Absorbing Amplifier Mk IV
entries: This item gains the absorbing 8 property. If it already has the absorbing property, its absorbing number increases by 8, to a maximum of 12.

item.name: Absorbing Amplifier Mk V

item.name: Absorbing Amplifier Mk VI

entries: This item gains the absorbing 8 property. If it already has the absorbing property, its absorbing number increases by 8, to a maximum of 12.

item.name: Absorbing Conductor (Ancient)
entries: This item gains the absorbing 12 property. If it already has the absorbing property, its absorbing number increases to 12.

item.name: Absorbing Conductor (Journeyman)

item.name: Absorbing Conductor (Novice)

item.name: Absorptive Reinforcement Mk II

item.name: Absorptive Reinforcement Mk III

item.name: Accessing Cycler (Cracked)

item.name: Accessing Cycler (Flawless)

item.name: Accessing Cycler (Perfect)
entries: This item gains the accessing 6 property. If it already has the accessing property, its accessing number increases to 6.

item.name: Accessing Cycler (Regular)
entries: This item gains the accessing 4 property. If it already has the accessing property, its accessing number increases by 4, to a maximum of 6.

entries: This item gains the accessing 2 property. If it already has the accessing property, its accessing number increases by 2, to a maximum of 6.

item.name: Accessing Motherboard (Excellent)
entries: This item gains the accessing 4 property. If it already has the accessing property, its accessing number increases by 4, to a maximum of 6.

item.name: Accessing Motherboard (Outstanding)

entries: This item gains the accessing 6 property. If it already has the accessing property, its accessing number increases to 6.

item.name: Accessing Motherboard (Simple)
entries: This item gains the accessing 1 property. If it already has the accessing property, its accessing number increases by 1, to a maximum of 6.

item.name: Accuracy Focus Mk I
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and a -1 penalty to damage rolls made with this weapon.

item.name: Accuracy Focus Mk II
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with this weapon.

item.name: Accuracy Focus Mk III
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls made with this weapon.

item.name: Accuracy Focus Mk IV
entries: You gain a +3 bonus to attack rolls made with this weapon.

item.name: Ace Pilot's Pattern (Basic)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Piloting} increases by one step (to trained, from trained to proficient, from proficient to expertise, from expertise to mastery, from mastery to high mastery, or from high mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Ace Pilot's Pattern (Choice)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Piloting} increases by four steps (to mastery, from trained to high mastery, or from proficient to grand mastery).

item.name: Ace Pilot's Pattern (Elite)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Piloting} increases by five steps (to high mastery or from trained to grand mastery).

item.name: Ace Pilot's Pattern (Exquisite)
entries: You gain grand mastery in {@skill Piloting}.

item.name: Ace Pilot's Pattern (Favored)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Piloting} increases by three steps (to expertise, from trained to mastery, from proficient to high mastery, or from expertise to grand mastery).

item.name: Ace Pilot's Pattern (Fine)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Piloting} increases by two steps (to proficient, from trained to expertise, from proficient to mastery, from expertise to high mastery, or from mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Acrobat's Pattern (Basic)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Acrobatics} increases by one step (to trained, from trained to proficient, from proficient to expertise, from expertise to mastery, from mastery to high mastery, or from high mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Acrobat's Pattern (Choice)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Acrobatics} increases by four steps (to mastery, from trained to high mastery, or from proficient to grand mastery).

item.name: Acrobat's Pattern (Elite)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Acrobatics} increases by five steps (to high mastery or from trained to grand mastery).

item.name: Acrobat's Pattern (Exquisite)
entries: You gain grand mastery in {@skill Acrobatics}.

item.name: Acrobat's Pattern (Favored)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Acrobatics} increases by three steps (to expertise, from trained to mastery, from proficient to high mastery, or from expertise to grand mastery).

item.name: Acrobat's Pattern (Fine)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Acrobatics} increases by two steps (to proficient, from trained to expertise, from proficient to mastery, from expertise to high mastery, or from mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Active Camouflage Core
entries: As an action, you can activate this augmentation to cast the {@spell infiltrate|orcnogSW5e} tech power targeting yourself. Intelligence is your tech casting ability for this power, and if you cast it using this augmentation, it does not require concentration.
{@b Side Effect:} While this augmentation is active, your speed is reduced by 10. Additionally, it fails to activate if you are submerged in water or other liquids.
{@i This internal augmentation can be activated to project a distortion field that bends visual light.}

item.name: Adapted Armor
entries: You have resistance to one type of damage while you wear this armor. The DM chooses the type or determines it randomly from the options below.
| {@dice d10} | Damage Type |
|  1  | Acid        |
|  2  | Cold        |
|  3  | Fire        |
|  4  | Force       |
|  5  | Ion         |
| {@dice d10} | Damage Type |
|  6  | Lightning   |
|  7  | Necrotic    |
|  8  | Poison      |
|  9  | Psychic     |
|  10 | Sonic       |
{@i Those foolhardy enough to not treat a hostile planet as worthy a foe as the ones carrying blasters don't often live long enough to boast about it.}

item.name: Adegan Crystal (Chipped)
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to damage rolls made with this weapon.

item.name: Adegan Crystal (Cracked)
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to damage rolls and a -1 penalty to attack rolls made with this weapon.

item.name: Adegan Crystal (Flawed)
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls made with this weapon.

item.name: Adegan Crystal (Regular)
entries: You gain a +3 bonus to damage rolls made with this weapon.

item.name: Agile Armoring Mk I
entries: This armor gains the agile 11 property. If it already has the agile property, its agile number increases by one step (from 11 to 13, 13 to 15, 15 to 17, 17 to 19, or 19 to 21).

item.name: Agile Armoring Mk II
entries: This armor gains the agile 13 property. If it already has the agile property, its agile number increases by two steps (from 11 to 15, 13 to 17, 15 to 19, or 17 to 21).

item.name: Agile Armoring Mk III
entries: This armor gains the agile 15 property. If it already has the agile property, its agile number increases by three steps (from 11 to 17, 13 to 19, or 15 to 21).

item.name: Agile Armoring Mk IV
entries: This armor gains the agile 17 property. If it already has the agile property, its agile number increases by four steps (from 11 to 19 or 13 to 21).

item.name: Agile Armoring Mk V
entries: This armor gains the agile 19 property. If it already has the agile property, its agile number increases by five steps (from 11 to 21).

item.name: Agile Armoring Mk VI
entries: This armor gains the agile 21 property. If it already has the agile property, its agile number increases to 21.

item.name: Alacrity Adrenal (Basic)
entries: As an action, you can administer this adrenal to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, the target's speed increases by 10 feet. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one adrenal at a time.

item.name: Alacrity Adrenal (Champion)
entries: As an action, you can administer this adrenal to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, the target's speed increases by 60 feet. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one adrenal at a time.

item.name: Alacrity Adrenal (Exceptional)
entries: As an action, you can administer this adrenal to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, the target's speed increases by 50 feet. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one adrenal at a time.

item.name: Alacrity Adrenal (Fine)
entries: As an action, you can administer this adrenal to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, the target's speed increases by 20 feet. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one adrenal at a time.

item.name: Alacrity Adrenal (Improved)
entries: As an action, you can administer this adrenal to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, the target's speed increases by 30 feet. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one adrenal at a time.

item.name: Alacrity Adrenal (Superior)
entries: As an action, you can administer this adrenal to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, the target's speed increases by 40 feet. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one adrenal at a time.

item.name: Ammo Pouch
entries: An ammo pouch is a small pouch, usually worn around the waist or chest, which holds 20 slug cartridges. When you reload a weapon, you can draw as much ammunition needed from this pouch without using an object interaction to do so. Instead of slug cartridges, you can instead store a power cell which takes up the space of 10 cartridges.

item.name: Ammo-feed belt
entries: This belt has slots to hold 60 slug cartridges, and can be connected to directly fuel a single blaster weapon that uses slug cartridges. Once per turn, if the powered weapon would be reloaded, it can be done without using an action using any ammunition in the belt. Connecting or disconnecting a weapon takes an action. Replacing 10 slug cartridges takes an action.

item.name: Amplifying Barrel (Basic)
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to damage rolls and a -1 penalty to attack rolls made with this weapon.

item.name: Amplifying Barrel (Fine)
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to damage rolls made with this weapon.

item.name: Amplifying Barrel (Improved)
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls made with this weapon.

item.name: Amplifying Barrel (Superior)
entries: You gain a +3 bonus to damage rolls made with this weapon.

item.name: Amplifying Channel (Ascendancy)
entries: This item gains the amplifying 3 property. If it already has the amplifying property, its amplifying number increases to 3.

item.name: Amplifying Channel (Fighting)
entries: This item gains the amplifying 1 property. If it already has the amplifying property, its amplifying number increases by 1, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Amplifying Channel (Mastery)
entries: This item gains the amplifying 2 property. If it already has the amplifying property, its amplifying number increases by 2, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Amplifying Processor (Ascendancy)
entries: This item gains the amplifying 3 property. If it already has the amplifying property, its amplifying number increases to 3.

item.name: Amplifying Processor (Fighting)
entries: This item gains the amplifying 1 property. If it already has the amplifying property, its amplifying number increases by 1, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Amplifying Processor (Mastery)
entries: This item gains the amplifying 2 property. If it already has the amplifying property, its amplifying number increases by 2, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Analysis Protocol
entries: You know the {@spell detect enhancement} and {@i toxin scan|orcnogSW5e} tech powers. You can cast each power once per day. Intelligence is your techcasting ability for these powers. You do not require use of a wristpad for these powers.

item.name: Andris
entries: Refined andris crystal, a spice mined most commonly on Sevarcos II, sharpens a creature's mind when smoked. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next minute, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d3} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Wisdom. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 10 minutes, during which they must roll a {@dice d3} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Wisdom. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Andris (Fine)
entries: Refined andris crystal, a spice mined most commonly on Sevarcos II, sharpens a creature's mind when smoked. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next minute, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d4} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Wisdom. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 1 hour, during which they must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Wisdom. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Andris (High Quality)
entries: Refined andris crystal, a spice mined most commonly on Sevarcos II, sharpens a creature's mind when smoked. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next 10 minutes, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d8} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Wisdom. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 4 hours, during which they must roll a {@dice d8} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Wisdom. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 20 Constitution saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Andris (Potent)
entries: Refined andris crystal, a spice mined most commonly on Sevarcos II, sharpens a creature's mind when smoked. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next hour, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d10} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Wisdom. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 22 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 4 hours, during which they must roll a {@dice d10} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Wisdom. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 22 Constitution saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Andris (Pure)
entries: Refined andris crystal, a spice mined most commonly on Sevarcos II, sharpens a creature's mind when smoked. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next hour, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d12} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Wisdom. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 24 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 8 hours, during which they must roll a {@dice d12} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Wisdom. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 24 Constitution saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Andris (Uncut)
entries: Refined andris crystal, a spice mined most commonly on Sevarcos II, sharpens a creature's mind when smoked. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next 10 minutes, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d6} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Wisdom. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 1 hour, during which they must roll a {@dice d6} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Wisdom. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Animal Handler's Pattern (Basic)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Animal Handling} increases by one step (to trained, from trained to proficient, from proficient to expertise, from expertise to mastery, from mastery to high mastery, or from high mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Animal Handler's Pattern (Choice)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Animal Handling} increases by four steps (to mastery, from trained to high mastery, or from proficient to grand mastery).

item.name: Animal Handler's Pattern (Elite)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Animal Handling} increases by five steps (to high mastery or from trained to grand mastery).

item.name: Animal Handler's Pattern (Exquisite)
entries: You gain grand mastery in {@skill Animal Handling}.

item.name: Animal Handler's Pattern (Favored)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Animal Handling} increases by three steps (to expertise, from trained to mastery, from proficient to high mastery, or from expertise to grand mastery).

item.name: Animal Handler's Pattern (Fine)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Animal Handling} increases by two steps (to proficient, from trained to expertise, from proficient to mastery, from expertise to high mastery, or from mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Antitoxkit
entries: An antitoxkit contained a variety of wide-spectrum antidote hypospray injectors that were designed to neutralize all known poisons. A kit has five charges. As an action, you can administer a charge of the kit to cure a target of one poison affecting them or to give them advantage on saving throws against poison for 1 hour. It confers no benefit to droids or constructs.

item.name: Aquatic rebreather
entries: Aquatic breathers are breath masks designed to operate underwater. While worn, the wearer can breathe both air and water.

item.name: Aratech Echo Belt
entries: While you wear this belt with its field on, Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks made to see you have disadvantage, and you have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide, as the belt funnels light around you. Activating or deactivating the belt takes an action.
{@i The success of this high-end stealth field generator emboldened Aratech to branch out into other hardware.}

item.name: Aratech Recycler Core Mk II
entries: When you use the burst feature of this weapon, you can choose to include up to 2 additional creatures within 5 feet of any affected space to also be affected the burst, if they were not already.

Once per turn, when you deal damage with this weapon, your walking speed increases by 10 feet until the start of your next turn, and the damaged creature can't make opportunity attacks against you for the rest of your turn.

item.name: Aratech Sound Dampening Boots
entries: While you wear these boots, your steps make no sound, regardless of the surface you are moving across. You also have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks that rely on moving silently.
{@i Before their repulsorcraft hit it big, Aratech honed its edge in the stealth field generator market.}

item.name: Armament and Defense Library
entries: You gain proficiency in all simple and martial weapons, all armor, and the {@skill Piloting} skill. Additionally, when you make an Intelligence check to recall or discern information about a weapon, piece of armor, or a military vehicle that this library contains information on, you are considered proficient in the check.

{@b Side Effect:} This aggressively effective library can make it difficult to focus in stressful situations. You have disadvantage on Constitution saving throws to maintain concentration. Additionally, you have disadvantage on ability checks while concentrating on a power.

{@i This small and unassuming electronic module installed in the parietal lobe contains a massive library of information pertaining to weapons, armor, droids, and every other defense system known to the galaxy at large. Even rare or obscure pieces of technology are described here, offering a unique perspective on the universe - if you can handle it.}

item.name: Armor (Champion)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to AC while wearing this armor. Additionally, while wearing this armor, damage you take is reduced by 2. If this would reduce the damage to 0, the damage is instead reduced to 1.

item.name: Armor (Exceptional)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to AC while wearing this armor. Additionally, while wearing this armor, damage you take is reduced by 1. If this would reduce the damage to 0, the damage is instead reduced to 1.

item.name: Armor (Fine)
entries: You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor.

item.name: Armor (Improved)
entries: You have a +2 bonus to AC while wearing this armor.

item.name: Armor (Superior)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to AC while wearing this armor.

item.name: Armor Chassis (Advanced)
entries: This modifiable armor chassis comes with vacant modification slots for armor modifications, as well as one augment slot. It can house modifications of advanced rarity or lower.

item.name: Armor Chassis (Artifact)
entries: This modifiable armor chassis comes with vacant modification slots for armor modifications, as well as two augment slots. It can house modifications of artifact rarity or lower.

item.name: Armor Chassis (Legendary)
entries: This modifiable armor chassis comes with vacant modification slots for armor modifications, as well as two augment slots. It can house modifications of legendary rarity or lower.

item.name: Armor Chassis (Premium)
entries: This modifiable armor chassis comes with vacant modification slots for armor modifications. It can house modifications of premium rarity or lower.

item.name: Armor Chassis (Prototype)
entries: This modifiable armor chassis comes with vacant modification slots for armor modifications, as well as one augment slot. It can house modifications of prototype rarity or lower.

item.name: Armor Chassis (Standard)
entries: This modifiable armor chassis comes with vacant modification slots for armor modifications. It can house modifications of standard rarity.

item.name: Arrow
entries: Arrows are ammunition used in bow weapons. When you would use poison to coat a weapon or slug cartridge you can instead coat an arrow with the poison. Once a {@condition poisoned} arrow hits a target, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Arrow, Combustive
entries: A combustive arrow is a specialized arrow for use with bow weapons. When the arrow hits another creature, object, or surface it detonates. Each creature within 5ft of the arrows detonation must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} fire damage. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage. Once the arrow hits a target, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Arrow, Electroshock
entries: An electroshock arrow is a specialized arrow for use with bow weapons. When you hit a creature with this arrow, the creature must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d3} ion damage and becomes {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and isn't {@condition stunned}. Once the arrow hits a target, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Arrow, Noisemaker
entries: A noisemaker arrow is a specialized arrow for use with bow weapons. When the arrow hits another creature, object, or surface it generates an explosion of sound that can be heard up to 100 feet away. If the target of the attack is a creature, the creature must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d6} sonic damage and is {@condition deafened} until the end of its next turn. Once the arrow hits a target, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Artificially Intelligent
entries: You install an artificial intelligence into this armor. While wearing this armor, when you make an ability check, this armor's artificial intelligence can take the {@action Help} action.
You can use this feature twice. You regain all expended uses when you complete a short or long rest.

item.name: Assault armor
entries: Assault armor improved on battle armor, with the benefit of micro-hydraulics that boost the efficacy of the operator. It offers better protection, but increased weight.

item.name: Atlatl
entries: This specialized gungan club can be used to throw grenades or similar objects at long distances. If you are wielding this weapon, as part of the action to throw a grenade, you can instead throw it using an atlatl you are holding. The grenade can be thrown at a short distance of 30ft and a long distance of 120ft. When throwing a grenade at long range, creatures within the radius of the grenade's explosion have advantage on the saving throw.  If you lack proficiency in the atlatl, you must roll the damage dice twice and take the lesser total.

item.name: Atmospheric Decanting Vessel
entries: This metal jug appears to be able to hold a gallon of liquid and weighs 12 pounds whether full or empty.

You can use an action and name one liquid from the table below to cause the jug to produce the chosen liquid. Afterward, you can open the jug as an action and pour that liquid out, up to 2 gallons per minute. The maximum amount of liquid the jug can produce depends on the liquid you named.
Once the jug starts producing a liquid, it can't produce a different one, or more of one that has reached its maximum, until the next dawn.
| Liquid | Quantity |
| Acid  | 8 ounces |
| Alcohol, strong  | 1 gallon |
| Alcohol, weak  | 4 gallons |
| Basic poison  | 1/2 ounce |
| Liquid | Quantity |
| Condiment | 2 gallons |
| Lubricant | 1 quart |
| Water, potable | 8 gallons |
| Water, stagnant | 12 gallons |
{@i Most liquids one might desire curiously only involve a handful of elements. This device collects a reservoir of them to recreate a selection of such liquids on demand.}

item.name: Automated Adrenal Package
entries: Once on your turn, you can activate this implant to gain the effects of an adrenal (no action required). This effect lasts for one minute, or until a different adrenal is chosen. You can choose from the following types of adrenals:

items: {@b Strength Adrenal:} You gain a +1 bonus to the damage rolls of melee weapon attacks, and your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift doubles. If it would already double, it instead triples.
{@b Alacrity Adrenal:} You gain a +1 bonus to the damage rolls of ranged weapon attacks, and your speed increases by 10 feet.
{@b Stamina Adrenal:} You gain 2 temporary hit points and a +2 bonus to Constitution saving throws.

entries: {@b Side Effect:} You can no longer benefit from other adrenals.

{@i This clear plasti-polymer implant has an appearance vaguely resembling a multi-limbed cephalopod, and must be carefully installed by a master cybertech. It attaches by wrapping around the medulla, and produces a variety of combat adrenals for its user's consumption. It also performs blood-cleansing work to reduce the liver damage (for species that have a liver) caused by long-term adrenal use.}

item.name: Avoidant Reinforcement
entries: This armor or shield gains the avoidant 1 property. If it already has the avoidant property, its avoidant property increases by 1, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Avoidant Reinforcement Mk II
entries: This armor or shield gains the avoidant 2 property. If it already has the avoidant property, its avoidant number increases by 2, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Avoidant Reinforcement Mk III
entries: This armor or shield gains the avoidant 3 property. If it already has the avoidant property, its avoidant number increases to 3.

item.name: Backpack
entries: A backpack stores 30 lb., not exceeding 1 cubic foot.

item.name: Balanced Shielding
entries: {@i {@b Prerequiste:} Shield}
This shield loses the imbalanced property.

item.name: Ballistic Polymer
entries: While you have temporary hit points, kinetic and energy damage you take is reduced by an amount equal to half your proficiency bonus (rounded up).

item.name: Ballistic Polymer (Exceptional)
entries: While you have temporary hit points, kinetic and energy damage you take is reduced by an amount equal to your proficiency bonus.

item.name: Bandolier
entries: A bandolier is worn across the chest. It has 12 pockets that can each hold a single item that weighs less than 2.00 lb, such as a vibrodagger, a fragmentation grenade, or a power cell. Once per turn, drawing an item from a bandolier does not require your object interaction.

item.name: Bansche Advanced 2ZBc
entries: When you spend tech points and deal damage with a tech power cast through this wristpad, you deal additional damage equal to the number of tech points spent.

item.name: Bansche Purifier MENAD Pro Mk I
entries: When you cast a tech power with this wristpad that gives you a bonus to AC or saving throws, you can increase that bonus by +1.

item.name: Baragwin Stealth Unit
entries: While wearing this belt, you can turn on its stealth field to cause yourself to become {@condition invisible}. While you are {@condition invisible}, anything you are carrying or wearing is {@condition invisible} with you. You become visible when you turn off the field. Turning the field on or off requires an action.

Deduct the time you are {@condition invisible}, in increments of 1 minute, from the belt's maximum duration of 2 hours. After 2 hours of use, the belt ceases to function. For every uninterrupted period of 12 hours the belt goes unused, it regains 1 hour of use.
{@i Those Baragwin who sought to turn their telepathic empathy into an asset for bounty hunting needed something special to overcome the drawbacks of their lumbering frames.}

item.name: Barbed Armoring
entries: This armor gains the barbed ({@dice 1d4}) property. If it already has the barbed property, the barbed damage increases by one step (from {@dice d4} to {@dice d6}, or from {@dice d6} to {@dice d8}).

item.name: Barbed Armoring Mk II
entries: This armor gains the barbed ({@dice 1d6}) property. If it already has the barbed property, the barbed damage increases by two steps (from {@dice d4} to {@dice d8}).

item.name: Barbed Armoring Mk III
entries: This armor gains the barbed ({@dice 1d8}) property. If it already has the barbed property, the barbed damage increases to {@dice d8}.

item.name: Battle Adrenal Mk I
entries: As an action, you can administer this adrenal to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, when the target takes the {@action Attack} action, it can make one additional attack (no action required). This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one adrenal at a time.

item.name: Battle Adrenal Mk II
entries: As an action, you can administer this adrenal to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, when the target takes the {@action Attack} action, it can make two additional attacks (no action required). This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one adrenal at a time.

item.name: Battle armor
entries: Battle armor is an armor that reduced weight, but restricts movement. The armor is commonly used by mercenaries, bounty hunters, soldiers, and civilians that live in dangerous areas.

item.name: Bayonet
entries: You affix a short blade to the barrel of this weapon, allowing you to make a melee weapon attack with it. The blade is a melee weapon with the finesse property that you are proficient with, and deals {@damage 1d6} kinetic damage.

item.name: Beemon Cardio-Regulator
entries: Your Constitution score is 19 while you wear this choker. It has no effect on you if your Constitution is already 19 or higher.
{@i Demand for Beemon Laboratories' implants streches even to those too sickly to use them without assistance from another of their fine products.}

item.name: Berserker Defensive Augment
entries: You learn an additional Berserker Instinct option.

item.name: Berserker Offensive Augment
entries: Your Rage damage bonus increases by 1, and when you score a critical hit, you can roll one additional weapon damage die and add the result to the total.

item.name: Binders
entries: Binders can be used to restrain a Small or Medium creature with appropriate appendages. Applying binders takes an action, and the target must make a DC 14 Strength or Dexterity saving throw (the target chooses the ability to use). A hostile creature makes this save with advantage. Breaking the binders requires a DC 20 Strength check. Escaping them requires a DC 20 Dexterity check. A set of binders comes with one key. Without the key, unlocking the binders requires a DC 15 {@skill security kit|orcnogSW5e} check to force open. Binders have an AC of 10 and 15 hit points. Destroying the binders frees the creature without harming it.

item.name: Binders (Champion)
entries: Binders can be used to restrain a Small or Medium creature with appropriate appendages. Applying binders takes an action, and the target must make a DC 24 Strength or Dexterity saving throw (the target chooses the ability to use). A hostile creature makes this save with advantage. A set of binders comes with one key. Breaking the binders requires a DC 30 Strength check. Escaping them requires a DC 30 Dexterity check. Without the key, unlocking the binders requires a DC 30 {@skill security kit|orcnogSW5e} check to force open. Binders have an AC of 15 and 90 hit points. Destroying the binders frees the creature without harming it.

item.name: Binders (Exceptional)
entries: Binders can be used to restrain a Small or Medium creature with appropriate appendages. Applying binders takes an action, and the target must make a DC 22 Strength or Dexterity saving throw (the target chooses the ability to use). A hostile creature makes this save with advantage. A set of binders comes with one key. Breaking the binders requires a DC 28 Strength check. Escaping them requires a DC 28 Dexterity check. Without the key, unlocking the binders requires a DC 27 {@skill security kit|orcnogSW5e} check to force open. Binders have an AC of 14 and 75 hit points. Destroying the binders frees the creature without harming it.

item.name: Binders (Fine)
entries: Binders can be used to restrain a Small or Medium creature with appropriate appendages. Applying binders takes an action, and the target must make a DC 16 Strength or Dexterity saving throw (the target chooses the ability to use). A hostile creature makes this save with advantage. A set of binders comes with one key. Breaking the binders requires a DC 22 Strength check. Escaping them requires a DC 22 Dexterity check. Without the key, unlocking the binders requires a DC 18 {@skill security kit|orcnogSW5e} check to force open. Binders have an AC of 11 and 30 hit points. Destroying the binders frees the creature without harming it.

item.name: Binders (Improved)
entries: Binders can be used to restrain a Small or Medium creature with appropriate appendages. Applying binders takes an action, and the target must make a DC 18 Strength or Dexterity saving throw (the target chooses the ability to use). A hostile creature makes this save with advantage. A set of binders comes with one key. Breaking the binders requires a DC 24 Strength check. Escaping them requires a DC 24 Dexterity check. Without the key, unlocking the binders requires a DC 21 {@skill security kit|orcnogSW5e} check to force open. Binders have an AC of 12 and 45 hit points. Destroying the binders frees the creature without harming it.

item.name: Binders (Superior)
entries: Binders can be used to restrain a Small or Medium creature with appropriate appendages. Applying binders takes an action, and the target must make a DC 20 Strength or Dexterity saving throw (the target chooses the ability to use). A hostile creature makes this save with advantage. A set of binders comes with one key. Breaking the binders requires a DC 26 Strength check. Escaping them requires a DC 26 Dexterity check. Without the key, unlocking the binders requires a DC 24 {@skill security kit|orcnogSW5e} check to force open. Binders have an AC of 13 and 60 hit points. Destroying the binders frees the creature without harming it.

item.name: Biochemist's kit
entries: Biochemist's kits are used to create and enhance medpacs and other healing implements.

item.name: Bioenhancement Matrix Mk I
entries: Your hit point maximum increases by an amount equal to your level, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

item.name: Bioenhancement Matrix Mk II
entries: Your hit point maximum increases by an amount equal to twice your level, and it increases by 2 every time you gain a level.

item.name: Bioenhancement Matrix Mk III
entries: Your hit point maximum increases by an amount equal to three times your level, and it increases by 3 every time you gain a level.

item.name: Biometric Safety Measures
entries: A security system is installed into the hilt of your lightweapon. When a creature other than you attempts to activate your lightweapon, the activation fails. Additionally, the creature attempting to activate it must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 1d10} lightning damage and is shocked until the end of its next turn. On a successful save the creature takes half damage and isn't shocked. On a success or failure, the creature then drops the weapon.

item.name: Bipod
entries: A bipod is a device mounted to a two-handed blaster weapon to offer increased stability while {@condition prone}. As an action, you can deploy or collapse the bipod. While deployed, you ignore the Strength requirement on the attached blaster weapon with the strength property while you are {@condition prone}, and your speed is reduced to 0. Additionally, while deployed and {@condition prone}, you have a +10 bonus to ability checks and saving throws to avoid being disarmed of the weapon.

item.name: Biting Crystal (Adept)
entries: This weapon gains the biting 16 property. If it already has the biting property, its biting number increases by 4, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Biting Crystal (Ancient)
entries: This weapon gains the biting 18 property. If it already has the biting property, its biting number increases to 18.

item.name: Biting Crystal (Apprentice)
entries: This weapon gains the biting 14 property. If it already has the biting property, its biting number increases by 2, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Biting Crystal (Journeyman)
entries: This weapon gains the biting 15 property. If it already has the biting property, its biting number increases by 3, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Biting Crystal (Master)
entries: This weapon gains the biting 17 property. If it already has the biting property, its biting number increases by 5, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Biting Crystal (Novice)
entries: This weapon gains the biting 13 property. If it already has the biting property, its biting number increases by 1, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Blaster Chassis (Advanced)
entries: This modifiable blaster chassis comes with vacant modification slots for blaster modifications, as well as one augment slot. It can house modifications of advanced rarity or lower.

item.name: Blaster Chassis (Artifact)
entries: This modifiable blaster chassis comes with vacant modification slots for blaster modifications, as well as two augment slots. It can house modifications of artifact rarity or lower.

item.name: Blaster Chassis (Legendary)
entries: This modifiable blaster chassis comes with vacant modification slots for blaster modifications, as well as two augment slots. It can house modifications of legendary rarity or lower.

item.name: Blaster Chassis (Premium)
entries: This modifiable blaster chassis comes with vacant modification slots for blaster modifications. It can house modifications of premium rarity or lower.

item.name: Blaster Chassis (Prototype)
entries: This modifiable blaster chassis comes with vacant modification slots for blaster modifications, as well as one augment slot. It can house modifications of prototype rarity or lower.

item.name: Blaster Chassis (Standard)
entries: This modifiable blaster chassis comes with vacant modification slots for blaster modifications. It can house modifications of standard rarity.

item.name: Blaster Integration
entries: You can now integrate a single simple or martial blaster into your droid chassis. Over the course of a short or long rest, you can insert and integrate this blaster into your frame. As a bonus action, you can open or close a small hatch located somewhere on your droid body, permitting you to wield and fire the weapon normally when you want to attack with it. While the hatch is open, your hands are not considered occupied by this blaster. All other rules and conditions apply normally as if you were wielding this blaster in either one or two hands (your choice).

item.name: Blaster cannon
entries: Rather than traditional power cells, the blaster cannon uses a specialized power generator that allows it to fire continuously for 10 minutes. Replacing a power generator takes an action.

Before firing the blaster cannon, you must deploy it using an action unless you meet its strength requirement. Alternatively, if you're able to make multiple attacks with the {@action Attack} action, this action replaces one of them.  While deployed in this way, you treat this weapon's strength number as two steps less (from 19 to 15), your speed is reduced by half, and you cannot fire this weapon at long range. You can collapse the blaster cannon as an action or bonus action.

item.name: Blueprint (Advanced)
entries: This blueprint contains information regarding the raw and rare materials, tools, and steps required to craft an item of advanced rarity. Over the course of 1 hour, which can be done during a short rest, a character can attempt to learn the blueprint. If they do so, they must make a DC 22 Intelligence check with the appropriate tools. On a success, the blueprint for the item is learned. On a failure, the blueprint is not learned, and the character must wait 24 hours before they can try again.
{@i Blueprints contain the secrets of how to craft items of a more complex nature.}

item.name: Blueprint (Artifact)
entries: This blueprint contains information regarding the raw and rare materials, tools, and steps required to craft an item of artifact rarity. Over the course of 1 hour, which can be done during a short rest, a character can attempt to learn the blueprint. If they do so, they must make a DC 30 Intelligence check with the appropriate tools. On a success, the blueprint for the item is learned. On a failure, the blueprint is not learned, and the character must wait 24 hours before they can try again.
{@i Blueprints contain the secrets of how to craft items of a more complex nature.}

item.name: Blueprint (Legendary)
entries: This blueprint contains information regarding the raw and rare materials, tools, and steps required to craft an item of legendary rarity. Over the course of 1 hour, which can be done during a short rest, a character can attempt to learn the blueprint. If they do so, they must make a DC 26 Intelligence check with the appropriate tools. On a success, the blueprint for the item is learned. On a failure, the blueprint is not learned, and the character must wait 24 hours before they can try again.
{@i Blueprints contain the secrets of how to craft items of a more complex nature.}

item.name: Blueprint (Premium)
entries: This blueprint contains information regarding the raw and rare materials, tools, and steps required to craft an item of premium rarity. Over the course of 1 hour, which can be done during a short rest, a character can attempt to learn the blueprint. If they do so, they must make a DC 14 Intelligence check with the appropriate tools. On a success, the blueprint for the item is learned. On a failure, the blueprint is not learned, and the character must wait 24 hours before they can try again.
{@i Blueprints contain the secrets of how to craft items of a more complex nature.}

item.name: Blueprint (Prototype)
entries: This blueprint contains information regarding the raw and rare materials, tools, and steps required to craft an item of prototype rarity. Over the course of 1 hour, which can be done during a short rest, a character can attempt to learn the blueprint. If they do so, they must make a DC 18 Intelligence check with the appropriate tools. On a success, the blueprint for the item is learned. On a failure, the blueprint is not learned, and the character must wait 24 hours before they can try again.
{@i Blueprints contain the secrets of how to craft items of a more complex nature.}

item.name: Blueprint (Standard)
entries: This blueprint contains information regarding the raw and rare materials, tools, and steps required to craft an item of standard rarity. Over the course of 1 hour, which can be done during a short rest, a character can attempt to learn the blueprint. If they do so, they must make a DC 10 Intelligence check with the appropriate tools. On a success, the blueprint for the item is learned. On a failure, the blueprint is not learned, and the character must wait 24 hours before they can try again.
{@i Blueprints contain the secrets of how to craft items of a more complex nature.}

item.name: Bo-rifle
entries: The bo-rifle is a lasat weapon most commonly carried by the Honor Guard of Lasan, which has the unique property of functioning as both a rifle and a staff. As a bonus action, you can switch between each mode, detailed below.
{@b {@i Rifle.}} While in this mode, the weapon uses traditional power cells.
{@b {@i Staff.}} While in this mode, the weapon gains the shocking property.

item.name: Bolas
entries: A Large or smaller creature hit by a bolas is {@condition restrained} until it is freed. A bolas has no effect on formless or Huge or larger creatures. A creature can use its action to make a DC 13 Dexterity check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. The bolas has an AC of 10, 5 hit points, and immunity to all damage not dealt by melee weapons. Destroying the bolas frees the creature without harming it and immediately ends the bolas's effects. While a creature is {@condition restrained} by a bolas, you can make no further attacks with it.
Due to their unwieldy nature, bolas make ineffective melee weapons. Melee attack rolls made with them are made at disadvantage.

item.name: Bolas (Champion)
entries: A Large or smaller creature hit by a bolas is {@condition restrained} until it is freed. A bolas has no effect on formless or Huge or larger creatures. A creature can use its action to make a DC 18 Dexterity check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. The bolas has an AC of 15, 30 hit points, immunity to all damage not dealt by melee weapons, and resistance to damage dealt by unenhanced melee weapons. Destroying the bolas frees the creature without harming it and immediately ends the bolas's effects. While a creature is {@condition restrained} by a bolas, you can make no further attacks with it.
Due to their unwieldy nature, bolas make ineffective melee weapons. Melee attack rolls made with them are made at disadvantage.

item.name: Bolas (Exceptional)
entries: A Large or smaller creature hit by a bolas is {@condition restrained} until it is freed. A bolas has no effect on formless or Huge or larger creatures. A creature can use its action to make a DC 17 Dexterity check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. The bolas has an AC of 14, 25 hit points, immunity to all damage not dealt by melee weapons, and resistance to damage dealt by unenhanced melee weapons. Destroying the bolas frees the creature without harming it and immediately ends the bolas's effects. While a creature is {@condition restrained} by a bolas, you can make no further attacks with it.
Due to their unwieldy nature, bolas make ineffective melee weapons. Melee attack rolls made with them are made at disadvantage.

item.name: Bolas (Fine)
entries: A Large or smaller creature hit by a bolas is {@condition restrained} until it is freed. A bolas has no effect on formless or Huge or larger creatures. A creature can use its action to make a DC 14 Dexterity check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. The bolas has an AC of 11, 10 hit points, immunity to all damage not dealt by melee weapons, and resistance to damage dealt by unenhanced melee weapons. Destroying the bolas frees the creature without harming it and immediately ends the bolas's effects. While a creature is {@condition restrained} by a bolas, you can make no further attacks with it.
Due to their unwieldy nature, bolas make ineffective melee weapons. Melee attack rolls made with them are made at disadvantage.

item.name: Bolas (Improved)
entries: A Large or smaller creature hit by a bolas is {@condition restrained} until it is freed. A bolas has no effect on formless or Huge or larger creatures. A creature can use its action to make a DC 15 Dexterity check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. The bolas has an AC of 12, 15 hit points, immunity to all damage not dealt by melee weapons, and resistance to damage dealt by unenhanced melee weapons. Destroying the bolas frees the creature without harming it and immediately ends the bolas's effects. While a creature is {@condition restrained} by a bolas, you can make no further attacks with it.
Due to their unwieldy nature, bolas make ineffective melee weapons. Melee attack rolls made with them are made at disadvantage.

item.name: Bolas (Superior)
entries: A Large or smaller creature hit by a bolas is {@condition restrained} until it is freed. A bolas has no effect on formless or Huge or larger creatures. A creature can use its action to make a DC 16 Dexterity check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. The bolas has an AC of 13, 20 hit points, immunity to all damage not dealt by melee weapons, and resistance to damage dealt by unenhanced melee weapons. Destroying the bolas frees the creature without harming it and immediately ends the bolas's effects. While a creature is {@condition restrained} by a bolas, you can make no further attacks with it.
Due to their unwieldy nature, bolas make ineffective melee weapons. Melee attack rolls made with them are made at disadvantage.

item.name: Bolstering Channel (Adept)
entries: This item gains the bolstering 8 property. If it already has the bolstering property, its bolstering number increases by 8, to a maximum of 12.

item.name: Bolstering Channel (Ancient)
entries: This item gains the bolstering 12 property. If it already has the bolstering property, its bolstering number increases to 12.

item.name: Bolstering Channel (Apprentice)
entries: This item gains the bolstering 4 property. If it already has the bolstering property, its bolstering number increases by 4, to a maximum of 12.

item.name: Bolstering Channel (Journeyman)
entries: This item gains the bolstering 6 property. If it already has the bolstering property, its bolstering number increases by 6, to a maximum of 12.

item.name: Bolstering Channel (Master)
entries: This item gains the bolstering 10 property. If it already has the bolstering property, its bolstering number increases by 10, to a maximum of 12.

item.name: Bolstering Channel (Novice)
entries: This item gains the bolstering 2 property. If it already has the bolstering property, its bolstering number increases by 2, to a maximum of 12.

item.name: Bolt
entries: Rather than traditional power cells, the bolt-thrower fires specialized projectiles in the form of bolts.

item.name: Bolt, Deafening
entries: This bolt-thrower ammunition deals {@damage 2d6} kinetic damage on a hit. Also on a hit, the creature must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 2d4} sonic damage on a failed save.
Additionally, on a failed save, a creature is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. At the end of an affected creature's turn, it can repeat this save, ending the effect on a success.

item.name: Bolt, Electrifying
entries: This bolt-thrower ammunition deals {@damage 2d6} kinetic damage on a hit. Also on a hit, the creature must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 2d4} lightning damage on a failed save.
Additionally, on a failed save, a creature is shocked for 1 minute. At the end of an affected creature's turn, it can repeat this save, ending the effect on a success.

item.name: Bolt, Panic
entries: This bolt-thrower ammunition deals {@damage 2d6} kinetic damage on a hit. Also on a hit, the creature must make a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw, taking {@damage 2d4} psychic damage on a failed save.
Additionally, on a failed save, a creature becomes {@condition frightened} of you for 1 minute. At the start of an affected creature's turn, it can repeat this save, ending the effect on a success.

item.name: Bolt-thrower
entries: Rather than traditional power cells, the bolt-thrower fires specialized projectiles in the form of bolts.

item.name: Bonded Plates Mk I
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to AC against melee attacks and a -1 penalty to AC against ranged attacks while wearing this armor or wielding this shield.

item.name: Bonded Plates Mk II
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to AC against melee attacks while wearing this armor or wielding this shield.

item.name: Bonded Plates Mk III
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to AC against melee attacks while wearing this armor or wielding this shield.

item.name: Bonded Plates Mk IV
entries: You gain a +3 bonus to AC against melee attacks while wearing this armor or wielding this shield.

item.name: Boots of Bounding
entries: This item can hold a number of charges equal to half your fighter level (rounded up). When you complete a long rest, this item regains all missing charges. On your turn, you can expend 1 or more charges to engage the rocket boosters and leap to a space you can see. For each charge spent, you can move up to 10 feet. Any opportunity attacks you provoke with this movement are made with disadvantage.

When you reach 5th level in fighter, when you use your Action Surge feature, your movement speed is doubled for the turn, you gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed until the end of your turn, though you fall if you end your speed in the air and nothing else is holding you aloft, and opportunity attacks made against you this turn have disadvantage.
When you reach 11th level in fighter, when you use your Indomitable feature, you have advantage on the roll.
When you reach 17th level in fighter, once per round, when you miss with a weapon attack, you can repeat the attack (no action required).
{@i These red and black boots come with integrated rocket boosters.}

item.name: Boots of Hiding
entries: While wearing these boots, creatures have disadvantage on Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks made to track your steps.

Additionally, you can use a bonus action to cause the boots to leave behind no footprints for 1 minute. When you do, another set of similar footprints appear on the ground that lead in random directions. These footprints last for 8 hours and travel up to 300 feet. A successful DC 14 Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check reveals that the footprints are false. Once you've used this feature, you must complete a short or long rest before you can use it again.

item.name: Bottle
entries: A bottle stores 1 and 1/2 pints of liquid.

item.name: Brawny Arm Prosthesis
entries: This augmentation replaces an arm.

When you make an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Strength using only this arm, your Strength score is treated as 15. When you make an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Strength using more than just this arm, you take the average of the arm's Strength score and your own.
{@b Side Effect:} When you roll a 1 on an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Strength with this arm, it seizes up, becoming unusable until the start of your next turn.
{@i These arm replacements are popular with the less exercise-inclined.}

item.name: Brawny Pattern (Basic)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Athletics} increases by one step (to trained, from trained to proficient, from proficient to expertise, from expertise to mastery, from mastery to high mastery, or from high mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Brawny Pattern (Choice)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Athletics} increases by four steps (to mastery, from trained to high mastery, or from proficient to grand mastery).

item.name: Brawny Pattern (Elite)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Athletics} increases by five steps (to high mastery or from trained to grand mastery).

item.name: Brawny Pattern (Exquisite)
entries: You gain grand mastery in {@skill Athletics}.

item.name: Brawny Pattern (Favored)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Athletics} increases by three steps (to expertise, from trained to mastery, from proficient to high mastery, or from expertise to grand mastery).

item.name: Brawny Pattern (Fine)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Athletics} increases by two steps (to proficient, from trained to expertise, from proficient to mastery, from expertise to high mastery, or from mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Bright Crystal (Adept)
entries: This weapon gains the bright 16 property. If it already has the bright property, its bright number increases by 4, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Bright Crystal (Ancient)
entries: This weapon gains the bright 18 property. If it already has the bright property, its bright number increases to 18.

item.name: Bright Crystal (Apprentice)
entries: This weapon gains the bright 14 property. If it already has the bright property, its bright number increases by 2, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Bright Crystal (Journeyman)
entries: This weapon gains the bright 15 property. If it already has the bright property, its bright number increases by 3, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Bright Crystal (Master)
entries: This weapon gains the bright 17 property. If it already has the bright property, its bright number increases by 5, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Bright Crystal (Novice)
entries: This weapon gains the bright 13 property. If it already has the bright property, its bright number increases by 1, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Brutal Cell
entries: This weapon gains the brutal 1 property. If it already has the brutal property, its brutal number increases by 1, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Brutal Cell (Deadly)
entries: This weapon gains the brutal 2 property. If it already has the brutal property, its brutal number increases by 2, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Brutal Cell (Devastating)
entries: This weapon gains the brutal 3 property. If it already has the brutal property, its brutal number increases to 3.

item.name: Brutal Oscillator
entries: This weapon gains the brutal 1 property. If it already has the brutal property, its brutal number increases by 1, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Brutal Oscillator (Deadly)
entries: This weapon gains the brutal 2 property. If it already has the brutal property, its brutal number increases by 2, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Brutal Oscillator (Devastating)
entries: This weapon gains the brutal 3 property. If it already has the brutal property, its brutal number increases to 3.

item.name: Brutal Scope
entries: This weapon gains the brutal 1 property. If it already has the brutal property, its brutal number increases by 1, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Brutal Scope (Deadly)
entries: This weapon gains the brutal 2 property. If it already has the brutal property, its brutal number increases by 2, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Brutal Scope (Devastating)
entries: This weapon gains the brutal 3 property. If it already has the brutal property, its brutal number increases to 3.

item.name: Bucket
entries: A bucket stores 3 gallons of liquid or 1/2 cubic foot of solids.

item.name: Burning Cell
entries: When you score a critical hit with this weapon, you have advantage on the next attack roll you make against that creature before the end of your next turn.

item.name: Burst Core
entries: This weapon gains the burst property, with a burst number equal to its reload number, minimum of 2. If it already has the burst property, the burst number is reduced to one-half its reload number (rounded up), to a minimum of 2.

item.name: Burst Core (Champion)
entries: This weapon gains the burst property, with a burst number equal to one-fourth its reload number (rounded up), to a minimum of 2. If it already has the burst property, the burst number is reduced to one-eighth its reload number (rounded up), to a minimum of 2.

item.name: Burst Core (Superior)
entries: This weapon gains the burst property, with a burst number equal to one-half its reload number (rounded up), to a minimum of 2. If it already has the burst property, the burst number is reduced to one-fourth its reload number (rounded up), to a minimum of 2.

item.name: Byrothsis Adept Cell
entries: When this weapon is levitated by the Force to deal damage through a class feature or force power you use, it deals additional damage equal to one of its weapon damage dice.

item.name: Byrothsis Ancient Cell
entries: When this weapon is levitated by the Force to deal damage through a class feature or force power you use, it deals additional damage equal to two of its weapon damage dice.

item.name: CNS Strength Enhancer
entries: While wearing this belt, your Strength score becomes 23. If your Strength is already equal to or greater than 23, it has no effect on you.
{@i This belt further increases a users physical power with pneumaticized assistance joists and a repulsorfield microgenerator.}

item.name: Camtono
entries: A camtono is a secured, handle container used for transporting valuable goods. A camtono comes with one key. Without the key, unlocking the camtono requires a DC 15 {@skill security kit|orcnogSW5e} check to force open. It stores 5 lb., not exceeding 1/4 cubic foot, has an AC of 10, and 15 hit points. Destroying the camtono risks damaging any goods stored inside.

item.name: Camtono (Champion)
entries: A camtono is a secured, handle container used for transporting valuable goods. A camtono comes with one key. Without the key, unlocking the camtono requires a DC 30 {@skill security kit|orcnogSW5e} check to force open. It stores 10 lb., not exceeding 3/8 cubic foot, has an AC of 15, and 90 hit points. Destroying the camtono risks damaging any goods stored inside.

item.name: Camtono (Exceptional)
entries: A camtono is a secured, handle container used for transporting valuable goods. A camtono comes with one key. Without the key, unlocking the camtono requires a DC 27 {@skill security kit|orcnogSW5e} check to force open. It stores 9 lb., not exceeding 3/8 cubic foot, has an AC of 14, and 75 hit points. Destroying the camtono risks damaging any goods stored inside.

item.name: Camtono (Fine)
entries: A camtono is a secured, handle container used for transporting valuable goods. A camtono comes with one key. Without the key, unlocking the camtono requires a DC 18 {@skill security kit|orcnogSW5e} check to force open. It stores 6 lb., not exceeding 1/4 cubic foot, has an AC of 11, and 30 hit points. Destroying the camtono risks damaging any goods stored inside.

item.name: Camtono (Improved)
entries: A camtono is a secured, handle container used for transporting valuable goods. A camtono comes with one key. Without the key, unlocking the camtono requires a DC 21 {@skill security kit|orcnogSW5e} check to force open. It stores 7 lb., not exceeding 1/4 cubic foot, has an AC of 12, and 45 hit points. Destroying the camtono risks damaging any goods stored inside.

item.name: Camtono (Superior)
entries: A camtono is a secured, handle container used for transporting valuable goods. A camtono comes with one key. Without the key, unlocking the camtono requires a DC 24 {@skill security kit|orcnogSW5e} check to force open. It stores 8 lb., not exceeding 3/8 cubic foot, has an AC of 13, and 60 hit points. Destroying the camtono risks damaging any goods stored inside.

item.name: Canteen
entries: A canteen stores 4 pints of liquid.

item.name: Cape of the Orator
entries: This item can hold a number of charges equal to half your scholar level (rounded up). When you complete a long rest, this item regains all missing charges. When your superiority die is rolled, you can expend one charge to reroll the die and choose either roll.

When you reach 5th level in scholar, you can maintain two targets of your Critical Analysis feature, instead of one. If you use your bonus action to analyze a third target, you choose which Critical Analysis ends.
When you reach 11th level in scholar, when you use your bonus action to use your Critical Analysis feature, you can target two creatures, instead of just one.
When you reach 17th level in scholar, you can take a third reaction each round. You can only take one reaction per turn.
{@i This color-shifting cloak is immune to wrinkles and always has a pressed appearance.}

item.name: Celerity Leg Prosthesis
entries: This augmentation replaces both legs.

When determining your bonus to AC and saving throws from Dexterity, your Dexterity score is treated as 15. Additionally, you can substitute this score for your own whenever you make an ability check or attack roll that uses your legs. If your Dexterity score is already equal to or greater than 15, it has no effect on you.
{@b Side Effect:} When you roll a 1 an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Dexterity that involves these legs, they seize up, reducing your speed to 0 until the start of your next turn.
{@i This leg replacement is common for those travelers interested in making a quick getaway.}

item.name: Celerity Oscillator
entries: Once per turn, when you deal damage with this weapon, your walking speed increases by 10 feet until the start of your next turn, and the damaged creature can't make opportunity attacks against you for the rest of your turn.

item.name: Cesta
entries: This specialized gungan staff can be used to throw grenades or similar objects at long distances. If you are wielding this weapon, as part of the action to throw a grenade, you can instead throw it using a cesta you are holding. The grenade can be thrown at a short distance of 60ft and a long distance of 240ft. When throwing a grenade at long range, creatures within the radius of the grenade's explosion have advantage on the saving throw. If you lack proficiency in the cesta, you must roll the damage dice twice and take the lesser total.

item.name: Channeling Amplifier (Dueling)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +2 bonus to melee force attacks.

item.name: Channeling Amplifier (Fighting)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +1 bonus to melee force attacks.

item.name: Channeling Amplifier (Mastery)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +3 bonus to melee force attacks.

item.name: Channeling Amplifier (Training)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +1 bonus to melee force attacks and a -1 penalty to ranged force attacks.

item.name: Channeling Rangefinder (Dueling)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +2 bonus to ranged force attacks.

item.name: Channeling Rangefinder (Fighting)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +1 bonus to ranged force attacks.

item.name: Channeling Rangefinder (Mastery)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +3 bonus to ranged force attacks.

item.name: Channeling Rangefinder (Training)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +1 bonus to ranged force attacks and a -1 penalty to melee force attacks.

item.name: Charge, Fragmentation (Average)
entries: A device used to blow holes in larger constructs and structures, a charge creates a devastating explosion focused in a specific direction. Installing a charge takes 1 minute. The charge can be set with a 6-second timer, or detonated remotely using a remote detonator.

When detonated, the charge explodes in a 15-foot cone. Each creature within the cone must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 20d6} kinetic damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. If affixed to a creature, that creature has disadvantage on the saving throw. Objects, structures, and other surfaces have disadvantage on the saving throw. If affixed to the object, structure, or surface, it instead automatically fails this saving throw.

item.name: Charge, Fragmentation (Deadly)

Each creature within the cone must make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 20d10} kinetic damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. If affixed to a creature, that creature has disadvantage on the saving throw. Objects, structures, and other surfaces have disadvantage on the saving throw. If affixed to the object, structure, or surface, it instead automatically fails this saving throw.

item.name: Charge, fragmentation
entries: A device used to blow holes in larger constructs and structures, a breaching charge creates a devastating explosion focused in a specific direction. Installing a breaching charge takes 1 minute. The charge can be set with a 6-second timer, or detonated remotely using a remote detonator.

When detonated, the breaching charge explodes in a 15-foot cone. Each creature within the cone must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 20d4} kinetic damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. If affixed to a creature, that creature has disadvantage on the saving throw. Objects, structures, and other surfaces have disadvantage on the saving throw. If affixed to the object, structure, or surface, it instead automatically fails this saving throw.
