item.name: Guard Amplifier (Adept)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +3 bonus to melee force attacks.

item.name: Guard Amplifier (Apprentice)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +1 bonus to melee force attacks.

item.name: Guard Amplifier (Journeyman)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +2 bonus to melee force attacks.

item.name: Guard Amplifier (Novice)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +1 bonus to melee force attacks and a -1 penalty to ranged force attacks.

item.name: Guard Rangefinder (Adept)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +3 bonus to ranged force attacks.

item.name: Guard Rangefinder (Apprentice)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +1 bonus to ranged force attacks.

item.name: Guard Rangefinder (Journeyman)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +2 bonus to ranged force attacks.

item.name: Guard Rangefinder (Novice)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +1 bonus to ranged force attacks and a -1 penalty to melee force attacks.

item.name: Guardian Defensive Augment
entries: You learn an additional Guardian Aura option, and the radius of your Guardian Auras increases by 5 feet.

item.name: Guardian Offensive Augment
entries: The damage die for your Focused Strike die and Improved Force-Empowered Strikes features increases by one step (from {@dice d8} to {@dice d10}, or {@dice d10} to {@dice d12}).

item.name: Handwraps (Basic)
entries: While wearing these handwraps, you have a +1 bonus to damage rolls made with your unarmed strikes.

item.name: Handwraps (Champion)
entries: While wearing these handwraps, you have a +3 bonus to attack rolls and deal an additional {@damage 1d10} damage with your unarmed strikes.

item.name: Handwraps (Exceptional)
entries: While wearing these handwraps, you have a +3 bonus to attack rolls and deal an additional {@damage 1d8} damage with your unarmed strikes.

item.name: Handwraps (Fine)
entries: While wearing these handwraps, you have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with your unarmed strikes.

item.name: Handwraps (Improved)
entries: While wearing these handwraps, you have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with your unarmed strikes.

item.name: Handwraps (Superior)
entries: While wearing these handwraps, you have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with your unarmed strikes.

item.name: Handwraps Chassis (Advanced)
entries: These modifiable handwraps chassis comes with vacant modification slots for vibroweapon modifications, as well as one augment slot. They can house modifications of advanced rarity or lower.

item.name: Handwraps Chassis (Artifact)
entries: These modifiable handwraps chassis comes with vacant modification slots for vibroweapon modifications, as well as two augment slots. They can house modifications of artifact rarity or lower.

item.name: Handwraps Chassis (Legendary)
entries: These modifiable handwraps chassis comes with vacant modification slots for vibroweapon modifications, as well as two augment slots. They can house modifications of legendary rarity or lower.

item.name: Handwraps Chassis (Premium)
entries: These modifiable handwraps chassis comes with vacant modification slots for vibroweapon modifications. They can house modifications of premium rarity or lower.

item.name: Handwraps Chassis (Prototype)
entries: These modifiable handwraps chassis comes with vacant modification slots for vibroweapon modifications, as well as one augment slot. They can house modifications of prototype rarity or lower.

item.name: Handwraps Chassis (Standard)
entries: These modifiable handwraps chassis comes with vacant modification slots for vibroweapon modifications. They can house modifications of standard rarity.

item.name: Hardy Torso Prosthesis
entries: This augmentation replaces your torso.
Your Constitution score becomes 13. If your Constitution score is already equal to or greater than 13, it has no effect on you. Additionally, you have advantage on saving throws against poison.
{@b Side Effect:} When you roll a 1 a Constitution saving throw to avoid {@condition exhaustion}, you suffer 2 levels of {@condition exhaustion}, instead of just 1.
{@i For the wary traveler who is desperately afraid of poison.}

item.name: Harpoon Reel Attachment
entries: You install a secondary firemode that launches a harpoon attached to a tightly coiled cord. With this harpoon, you can make a ranged weapon attack with a range of 30/60. On a hit, it deals {@damage 1d6} kinetic damage. This attack can target a surface, object, or creature.

A creature struck by this attack is impaled by the harpoon. As an action, a creature can attempt to remove the harpoon. Removing the harpoon requires a DC 15 Strength check. While the harpoon is stuck in the target, you are connected to the target by a 60 foot cable.

While connected in this manner, you can use your bonus action to activate the reel, pulling yourself to the location if the target is your size or larger. A creature or object smaller than you is pulled to you. Alternatively, you can opt to release the cable (no action required).
Once you've used this feature, you can't use it again until you recover and reinsert the harpoon as an action.

item.name: Harpoon Reel Guard
entries: You install a secondary firemode that launches a harpoon attached to a tightly coiled cord. With this harpoon, you can make a ranged weapon attack with a range of 30/60. On a hit, it deals {@damage 1d6} kinetic damage. This attack can target a surface, object, or creature.

A creature struck by this attack is impaled by the harpoon. As an action, a creature can attempt to remove the harpoon. Removing the harpoon requires a DC 15 Strength check. While the harpoon is stuck in the target, you are connected to the target by a 60 foot cable.

While connected in this manner, you can use your bonus action to activate the reel, pulling yourself to the location if the target is your size or larger. A creature or object smaller than you is pulled to you. Alternatively, you can opt to release the cable (no action required).
Once you've used this feature, you can't use it again until you recover and reinsert the harpoon as an action.

item.name: Hawkeye Ocular Package
entries: This augmentation replaces your eyes.

You can activate or deactivate this augmentation as a bonus action. While this augmentation is active, you gain advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight beyond 30 feet. In conditions of clear visibility, you can make out details of even extremely distant creatures and objects as small as 2 feet across.
{@b Side Effect:} While this augmentation is active, you have disadvantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) and Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) checks within 30 feet that rely on sight.
{@i This eye replacement features integrated macrobinoculars, granting improved ability to see further away.}

item.name: Headcomm
entries: A headcomm can be installed in a helmet or worn independently. It functions as a hands-free @{item commlink|orcnogSW5e}.

item.name: Heat generator
entries: Heat generators are special devices typically worn on belts that function as a portable, personal heat supply. Activating or deactivating the generator requires a bonus action and, while active, you are adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide. The generator lasts for 10 minutes and can be recharged by a power source or replacing the power cell.

item.name: Heavy Cell
entries: This weapon gains the heavy property.

item.name: Heavy Oscillator
entries: This weapon gains the heavy property.

item.name: Heavy Suit
entries: You enhance this armor, making it difficult to move. As a bonus action, you can anchor or deanchor your feet to the ground. While anchored, your speed is 0, you have advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws, and your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift doubles. If it would already double, it instead triples.

item.name: Heavy exoskeleton
entries: Heavy exoskeletons are virtually the heaviest armor acquirable during the Galactic War. It is ideal for extreme combat situations that involved direct damage and also offers a very good level of protection in sacrifice of dexterity. Some consider it claustrophobic but that was the trade-off for safety.

item.name: Helisaber Attachment
entries: As a bonus action, you can activate the attachment. While active, you have a 30-foot flying speed, and whenever you take damage you must make a concentration check as if concentrating on a power. On a failure, you immediately fall to the ground.

item.name: Hewey
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls with this enhanced weapon.

This weapon has 6 charges and regains {@dice 1d6} charges when you complete a long rest. Once per turn when you hit with a melee weapon attack with this weapon, you can expend a charge to have the weapon deal an additional {@damage 1d8} kinetic damage.
{@i Hewey is an N-30 battle blade owned by the mercenary Corso Riggs during the Galactic Cold War.}

item.name: Hidden Compartment Blaster
entries: This implant includes a small hidden blaster that is completely shielded and hidden from unenhanced investigation. You cannot use this hidden blaster until it is revealed. As a bonus action, you can reveal this weapon and make a single ranged weapon attack with it. You have proficiency with this weapon for this attack. It deals {@damage 1d4} energy damage on a hit, has a range of 20/60, and the light and reload 4 properties.

{@b Side Effect:} Reloading this weapon takes longer than usual. You can reload and re-conceal this weapon over one hour, which can be done during a short rest. This hidden compartment can only fit the specific blaster with which it is paired.
{@i This augmentation hides a weapon in its wearer's forearm that is almost completely undetectable by modern sensors.}

item.name: High-Grade Cybernetic Arm
entries: This augmentation replaces an arm.

When you hit with a melee weapon attack using Strength with a weapon wielded by this arm, you gain a +1 bonus to the damage roll. Additionally, when you make a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check that involves this arm, you gain a +1 bonus to the check.
{@b Side Effect:} You have disadvantage on melee weapon attacks and ability checks using Dexterity that involve this arm.
{@i This arm replacement features enhanced strength.}

item.name: High-Grade Cybernetic Legs
entries: This augmentation replaces both legs.

You gain advantage on Strength ability checks and Strength saving throws, you can make a running long jump or a running high jump after moving only 5 feet on foot, rather than 10 feet, and your speed increases by 10 feet.
{@b Side Effect:} Your powerful legs have difficulty moving quietly. You have disadvantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks that rely on moving silently.
{@i This mechanical leg replacement increases speed and jumping height.}

item.name: Hilt Blaster
entries: You convert this weapon's hilt into a small blaster. The blaster is a ranged weapon with the range 20/60 and reload 6 properties that you are proficient with, and deals {@damage 1d4} energy damage.

item.name: Holocomm
entries: A holocomm is a communications unit that utilizes the HoloNet. It enables users to send and receive messages through holographic-based transmission networks.

item.name: Holocron
entries: Holocrons are information-storage devices used by force wielders that contain ancient lessons or valuable information in holographic form. They appear as palm-sized, glowing polyhedrons of crystalline material and hardware, and can only be activated and used through the power of the Force.

item.name: Holocron (Adept)
entries: This holocron contains a single 5th-level force power, or multiple powers of 1st-4th level with a combined level no greater than 5. After meditating with the holocron for at least 16 hours, a forcecaster with a Max Power Level of 5th or higher can make a DC 22 forcecasting ability check with proficiency based on the alignment of the power(s) stored within. On a success, they learn the {@spell contained|orcnogSW5e} force power(s), which does not count against their force powers known and can not be unlearned except through use of a {@i remove curse} power. On a failure, the power is not learned and the forcecaster can't try again for 24 hours.
{@i Holocrons are information-storage devices used by Force-wielders that contain ancient lessons or valuable information in holographic form.}

item.name: Holocron (Ancient)
entries: This holocron contains a single 9th-level force power, or multiple powers of 1st-8th level with a combined level no greater than 9. After meditating with the holocron for at least 80 hours, a forcecaster with a Max Power Level of 9th or higher can make a DC 30 forcecasting ability check with proficiency based on the alignment of the power(s) stored within. On a success, they learn the {@spell contained|orcnogSW5e} force power(s), which does not count against their force powers known and can not be unlearned except through use of a {@i remove curse} power. On a failure, the power is not learned and the forcecaster can't try again for 24 hours.
{@i Holocrons are information-storage devices used by Force-wielders that contain ancient lessons or valuable information in holographic form.}

item.name: Holocron (Apprentice)
entries: This holocron contains a single 1st-level force power. After meditating with the holocron for at least 4 hours, a forcecaster with a Max Power Level of 1st or higher can make a DC 14 forcecasting ability check with proficiency based on the alignment of the power stored within. On a success, they learn the {@spell contained|orcnogSW5e} force power, which does not count against their force powers known and can not be unlearned except through use of a {@i remove curse} power. On a failure, the power is not learned and the forcecaster can't try again for 24 hours.
{@i Holocrons are information-storage devices used by Force-wielders that contain ancient lessons or valuable information in holographic form.}

item.name: Holocron (Journeyman)
entries: This holocron contains a single 3rd-level force power, or multiple powers of 1st-2nd level with a combined level no greater than 3. After meditating with the holocron for at least 8 hours, a forcecaster with a Max Power Level of 3rd or higher can make a DC 18 forcecasting ability check with proficiency based on the alignment of the power(s) stored within. On a success, they learn the {@spell contained|orcnogSW5e} force power(s), which does not count against their force powers known and can not be unlearned except through use of a {@i remove curse} power. On a failure, the power is not learned and the forcecaster can't try again for 24 hours.
{@i Holocrons are information-storage devices used by Force-wielders that contain ancient lessons or valuable information in holographic form.}

item.name: Holocron (Master)
entries: This holocron contains a single 7th-level force power, or multiple powers of 1st-6th level with a combined level no greater than 7. After meditating with the holocron for at least 40 hours, a forcecaster with a Max Power Level of 7th or higher can make a DC 26 forcecasting ability check with proficiency based on the alignment of the power(s) stored within. On a success, they learn the {@spell contained|orcnogSW5e} force power(s), which does not count against their force powers known and can not be unlearned except through use of a {@i remove curse} power. On a failure, the power is not learned and the forcecaster can't try again for 24 hours.
{@i Holocrons are information-storage devices used by Force-wielders that contain ancient lessons or valuable information in holographic form.}

item.name: Holocron (Novice)
entries: This holocron contains a single at-will force power. After meditating with the holocron for at least 2 hours, a forcecaster with a Max Power Level of 1st or higher can make a DC 10 forcecasting ability check with proficiency based on the alignment of the power stored within. On a success, they learn the {@spell contained|orcnogSW5e} force power, which does not count against their force powers known and can not be unlearned except through use of a {@i remove curse} power. On a failure, the power is not learned and the forcecaster can't try again for 24 hours.
{@i Holocrons are information-storage devices used by Force-wielders that contain ancient lessons or valuable information in holographic form.}

item.name: Holorecorder
entries: A holorecorder is a device used to record and project holograms. Some droid models are equipped with internal holorecorders.

item.name: Holotrace device
entries: A holotrace device is a wrist-worn gadget that can be used to trace a holographic transmission back to its source.

item.name: Holster
entries: A holster can be worn on the leg, hip, or back, and can be used to store a single weapon. You can draw a weapon stored in a holster without using an action. Once you've done so, you can't do so again until you store a weapon in the holster as an action.

item.name: Homing beacon
entries: A homing beacon is a device used to track starships or any other entity being transported. Homing beacons transmit using non-mass HoloNet transceivers able to be tracked through hyperspace. Homing beacons are small enough that they can easily be hidden inside a ship, or tucked into some crevice on its exterior.

item.name: Horizontal Exojets
entries: Whenever you take the {@action Dodge} or {@action Dash} actions, your walking speed increases by 10 feet until the end of your turn.

item.name: Hovercart
entries: This repulsorcraft is designed to efficiently move large amounts of goods. It has a speed of 30 feet and can store 2,000 lb., not exceeding 120 cubic feet.

item.name: Humanoid Replicant
entries: Your droid gains an exterior layer that makes it indistinguishable from a species of your choice of the same size. Additionally, you have advantage on checks made to conceal your nature, and scanners of standard rarity or lower automatically fail to determine that you are a droid.

item.name: Hydraulic Equalizer
entries: This armor or shield's strength number is reduced by one step (from 21 to 19, 19 to 17, 17 to 15, 15 to 13, or 13 to 11). If the strength number is 11, this modification removes the strength property from it entirely.

item.name: Hydraulic Equalizer Mk II
entries: This armor or shield's strength number is reduced by two steps (from 21 to 17, 19 to 15, 17 to 13, or 15 to 11). If the strength number is 13 or lower, this modification removes the strength property from it entirely.

item.name: Hydraulic Equalizer Mk III
entries: This armor or shield's strength number is reduced by three steps (from 21 to 15, 19 to 13, or 17 to 11). If the strength number is 15 or lower, this modification removes the strength property from it entirely.

item.name: Hydraulic Equalizer Mk IV
entries: This armor or shield's strength number is reduced by four steps (from 21 to 13 or 19 to 11). If the strength number is 17 or lower, this modification removes the strength property from it entirely.

item.name: Hydraulic Equalizer Mk V
entries: This armor or shield's strength number is reduced by five steps (from 21 to 11). If the strength number is 19 or lower, this modification removes the strength property from it entirely.

item.name: Hydraulic Equalizer Mk VI
entries: This armor or shield loses the strength property.

item.name: IWS
item.modal: {@item blaster rifle|orcnogSW5e}, {@item grenade launcher|orcnogSW5e}, and {@item sniper rifle|orcnogSW5e}

item.name: Impermeable Armoring
entries: This armor gains the impermeable property.

item.name: Incendiary Cell (Average)
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced incendiary cell. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the incendiary cell is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus. Additionally, the loaded weapon deals fire damage instead of its normal damage type, and when you hit with a shot it sets the ground beneath it in a 5-foot square ablaze for 1 minute. When a creature enters the fire or starts its turn there it must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d8} fire damage or half as much on a successful one. A construct makes this save with disadvantage.

item.name: Incendiary Cell (Deadly)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced incendiary cell. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the incendiary cell is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus. Additionally, the loaded weapon deals fire damage instead of its normal damage type, and when you hit with a shot it sets the ground beneath it in a 5-foot square ablaze for 1 minute. When a creature enters the fire or starts its turn there it must make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d8} fire damage or half as much on a successful one. A construct makes this save with disadvantage.

item.name: Incendiary Cell (Devastating)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced incendiary cell. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the incendiary cell is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus. Additionally, the loaded weapon deals fire damage instead of its normal damage type, and when you hit with a shot it sets the ground beneath it in a 5-foot square ablaze for 1 minute. When a creature enters the fire or starts its turn there it must make a DC 24 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d12} fire damage or half as much on a successful one. A construct makes this save with disadvantage.

item.name: Incendiary Cell (Lethal)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced incendiary cell. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the incendiary cell is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus. Additionally, the loaded weapon deals fire damage instead of its normal damage type, and when you hit with a shot it sets the ground beneath it in a 5-foot square ablaze for 1 minute. When a creature enters the fire or starts its turn there it must make a DC 22 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d10} fire damage or half as much on a successful one. A construct makes this save with disadvantage.

item.name: Incendiary Cell (Major)
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced incendiary cell. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the incendiary cell is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus. Additionally, the loaded weapon deals fire damage instead of its normal damage type, and when you hit with a shot it sets the ground beneath it in a 5-foot square ablaze for 1 minute. When a creature enters the fire or starts its turn there it must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d8} fire damage or half as much on a successful one. A construct makes this save with disadvantage.

item.name: Incendiary cell
entries: An incendiary cell is a specialized power cell for use with blaster weapons that deal acid, energy, fire, ion, or sonic damage. The loaded weapon deals fire damage instead of its normal damage type, and when you hit with a shot it sets the ground beneath it in a 5-foot square ablaze for 1 minute. When a creature enters the fire or starts its turn there it must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d8} fire damage or half as much on a successful one. A construct makes this save with disadvantage.

item.name: Inconspicuous Shielding
entries: {@i {@b Prerequiste:} Shield}
This shield loses the obtrusive property.

item.name: Increasing Cycler (Adept)
entries: This item gains the increasing 40 property. If it already has the increasing property, its increasing number increases by 40, to a maximum of 60.

item.name: Increasing Cycler (Ancient)
entries: This item gains the increasing 60 property. If it already has the increasing property, its increasing number increases to 60.

item.name: Increasing Cycler (Apprentice)
entries: This item gains the increasing 20 property. If it already has the increasing property, its increasing number increases by 20, to a maximum of 60.

item.name: Increasing Cycler (Journeyman)
entries: This item gains the increasing 30 property. If it already has the increasing property, its increasing number increases by 30, to a maximum of 60.

item.name: Increasing Cycler (Master)
entries: This item gains the increasing 50 property. If it already has the increasing property, its increasing number increases by 50, to a maximum of 60.

item.name: Increasing Cycler (Novice)
entries: This item gains the increasing 10 property. If it already has the increasing property, its increasing number increases by 10, to a maximum of 60.

item.name: Increasing Motherboard Mk I
entries: This item gains the increasing 10 property. If it already has the increasing property, its increasing number increases by 10, to a maximum of 60.

item.name: Increasing Motherboard Mk II
entries: This item gains the increasing 20 property. If it already has the increasing property, its increasing number increases by 20, to a maximum of 60.

item.name: Increasing Motherboard Mk III
entries: This item gains the increasing 30 property. If it already has the increasing property, its increasing number increases by 30, to a maximum of 60.

item.name: Increasing Motherboard Mk IV
entries: This item gains the increasing 40 property. If it already has the increasing property, its increasing number increases by 40, to a maximum of 60.

item.name: Increasing Motherboard Mk V
entries: This item gains the increasing 50 property. If it already has the increasing property, its increasing number increases by 50, to a maximum of 60.

item.name: Increasing Motherboard Mk VI
entries: This item gains the increasing 60 property. If it already has the increasing property, its increasing number increases to 60.

item.name: Indomitable Fortress Package
entries: Your Constitution score increases by 1, and your maximum for this score increases by 1. Additionally, you have advantage on Constitution saving throws.
{@b Side Effect:} One ability score other than Constitution (chosen by the GM) decreases by 1.
{@i This implant drastically increases your endurance.}

item.name: Infiltration Package
entries: This augmentation replaces a hand.

This implant appears to be a standard cybernetic mechanical arm, but conceals a {@item security kit|orcnogSW5e} and a {@item slicer's kit|orcnogSW5e}. Additionally, you can also use an action to cast {@spell release|orcnogSW5e} at 2nd level without expending tech points or use of a tech focus. Intelligence is your techcasting ability for this power. Once you've done so, you can't do so again until you complete a long rest.
{@b Side Effect:} This hand can no longer wield items that weigh more than 7 lbs.
{@i This fully cybernetic hand replacement contains a hidden array of infiltration tools optimized for defeating a wide variety of security barriers.}

item.name: Inflating Amplifier (Adequate)
entries: This item gains the inflating 10 property. If it already has the inflating property, its inflating number increases by 10, to a maximum of 30.

item.name: Inflating Amplifier (Excellent)
entries: This item gains the inflating 20 property. If it already has the inflating property, its inflating number increases by 20, to a maximum of 30.

item.name: Inflating Amplifier (Leading)
entries: This item gains the inflating 15 property. If it already has the inflating property, its inflating number increases by 15, to a maximum of 30.

item.name: Inflating Amplifier (Outstanding)
entries: This item gains the inflating 25 property. If it already has the inflating property, its inflating number increases by 25, to a maximum of 30.

item.name: Inflating Amplifier (Prime)
entries: This item gains the inflating 30 property. If it already has the inflating property, its inflating number increases to 30.

item.name: Inflating Amplifier (Simple)
entries: This item gains the inflating 5 property. If it already has the inflating property, its inflating number increases by 5, to a maximum of 30.

item.name: Inflating Conductor (Chipped)
entries: This item gains the inflating 10 property. If it already has the inflating property, its inflating number increases by 10, to a maximum of 30.

item.name: Inflating Conductor (Cracked)
entries: This item gains the inflating 5 property. If it already has the inflating property, its inflating number increases by 5, to a maximum of 30.

item.name: Inflating Conductor (Flawed)
entries: This item gains the inflating 15 property. If it already has the inflating property, its inflating number increases by 15, to a maximum of 30.

item.name: Inflating Conductor (Flawless)
entries: This item gains the inflating 25 property. If it already has the inflating property, its inflating number increases by 25, to a maximum of 30.

item.name: Inflating Conductor (Perfect)
entries: This item gains the inflating 30 property. If it already has the inflating property, its inflating number increases to 30.

item.name: Inflating Conductor (Regular)
entries: This item gains the inflating 20 property. If it already has the inflating property, its inflating number increases by 20, to a maximum of 30.

item.name: Inlay Amplifier (Adept)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +3 bonus to melee force attacks.

item.name: Inlay Amplifier (Apprentice)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +1 bonus to melee force attacks.

item.name: Inlay Amplifier (Journeyman)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +2 bonus to melee force attacks.

item.name: Inlay Amplifier (Novice)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +1 bonus to melee force attacks and a -1 penalty to ranged force attacks.

item.name: Inlay Rangefinder (Adept)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +3 bonus to ranged force attacks.

item.name: Inlay Rangefinder (Apprentice)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +1 bonus to ranged force attacks.

item.name: Inlay Rangefinder (Journeyman)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +2 bonus to ranged force attacks.

item.name: Inlay Rangefinder (Novice)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +1 bonus to ranged force attacks and a -1 penalty to melee force attacks.

item.name: Inquisitor Saber
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced weapon.

As a bonus action, you cause the lightsaber to rapidly spin. When you do so, you lose the +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the weapon, but you gain a +1 bonus to AC. Additionally, while spinning, you have a 30-foot flying speed. While flying, if you take damage, you must make a concentration check as if concentrating on a power. On a failure, you immediately fall to the ground.
{@i These lightweapons, favored by the Jedi hunters known as Inquisitors, have the unique ability to rapidly spin, granting its wielder a limited flying ability.}

item.name: Insulated Reinforcement (Basic)
entries: This armor or shield gains the insulated 5 property. If it already has the insulated property, its insulated number increases by 1, to a maximum of 10.

item.name: Insulated Reinforcement (Champion)
entries: This armor or shield gains the insulated 10 property. If it already has the insulated property, its insulated number increases to 10.

item.name: Insulated Reinforcement (Exceptional)
entries: This armor or shield gains the insulated 9 property. If it already has the insulated property, its insulated number increases by 5, to a maximum of 10.

item.name: Insulated Reinforcement (Fine)
entries: This armor or shield gains the insulated 6 property. If it already has the insulated property, its insulated number increases by 2, to a maximum of 10.

item.name: Insulated Reinforcement (Improved)
entries: This armor or shield gains the insulated 7 property. If it already has the insulated property, its insulated number increases by 3, to a maximum of 10.

item.name: Insulated Reinforcement (Superior)
entries: This armor or shield gains the insulated 8 property. If it already has the insulated property, its insulated number increases by 4, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Integrated Jetboosters Mk I
entries: This armor has a jetpack built in. Activating or deactivating the jetpack requires a bonus action and, while active, you have a flying speed of 30 feet. The jetpack last for 1 minute per power cell (to a maximum of 10 minutes) and can be recharged by a power source or replacing the power cells.

item.name: Integrated Subdermal Armor
entries: When you aren't wearing armor, your AC becomes 13 + your Dexterity modifier.
{@b Side Effect:} Each time you take damage while you aren't wearing armor, your speed decreases by 5 feet until the start of your next turn.
{@i This implant reinforces your skin with an ablative woven alloy, making you difficult to damage.}

item.name: Integrated Subdermal Armor Mk II
entries: When you aren't wearing armor, your AC becomes 14 + your Dexterity modifier.
{@b Side Effect:} Each time you take damage while you aren't wearing armor, your speed decreases by 5 feet until the start of your next turn.
{@i This implant reinforces your skin with a high-strength cortosis reinforcement, making you very difficult to damage.}

item.name: Intelligence Augment (Basic)
entries: Your Intelligence score increases by 1. One ability score other than Intelligence (chosen by the GM) decreases by 1.

item.name: Intelligence Augment (Champion)
entries: Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your maximum for this score increases by 2.

item.name: Intelligence Augment (Exceptional)
entries: Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your maximum for this score increases by 1.

item.name: Intelligence Augment (Fine)
entries: Your Intelligence score increases by 1.

item.name: Intelligence Augment (Improved)
entries: Your Intelligence score increases by 1, and your maximum for this score increases by 1. One ability score other than Intelligence (chosen by the GM) decreases by 1.

item.name: Intelligence Augment (Superior)
entries: Your Intelligence score increases by 1, and your maximum for this score increases by 1.

item.name: Intelligence Enhancement (Basic)
entries: Your Intelligence score increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.
{@b Side Effect:} One ability score other than Intelligence (chosen by the GM) decreases by 1.

item.name: Intelligence Stim (Basic)
entries: As an action, you can administer this stimpac to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this stimpac, the target's Intelligence score increases by 2, to a maximum of 20. This effect lasts for 1 hour. A creature can benefit from only one stimpac at a time.

item.name: Intelligence Stim (Champion)
entries: As an action, you can administer this stimpac to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this stimpac, the target's Intelligence score increases by 10, and its maximum for this score increases by 10. This effect lasts for 1 hour. A creature can benefit from only one stimpac at a time.

item.name: Intelligence Stim (Exceptional)
entries: As an action, you can administer this stimpac to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this stimpac, the target's Intelligence score increases by 8, and its maximum for this score increases by 8. This effect lasts for 1 hour. A creature can benefit from only one stimpac at a time.

item.name: Intelligence Stim (Fine)
entries: As an action, you can administer this stimpac to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this stimpac, the target's Intelligence score increases by 2, and its maximum for this score increases by 2. This effect lasts for 1 hour. A creature can benefit from only one stimpac at a time.

item.name: Intelligence Stim (Improved)
entries: As an action, you can administer this stimpac to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this stimpac, the target's Intelligence score increases by 4, and its maximum for this score increases by 4. This effect lasts for 1 hour. A creature can benefit from only one stimpac at a time.

item.name: Intelligence Stim (Superior)
entries: As an action, you can administer this stimpac to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this stimpac, the target's Intelligence score increases by 6, and its maximum for this score increases by 6. This effect lasts for 1 hour. A creature can benefit from only one stimpac at a time.

item.name: Intelligence Weave (Basic)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Intelligence saving throws increases by one step (to trained, from trained to proficient, from proficient to expertise, from expertise to mastery, from mastery to high mastery, or from high mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Intelligence Weave (Exceptional)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Intelligence saving throws increases by three steps (to expertise, from trained to mastery, from proficient to high mastery, or from expertise to grand mastery).

item.name: Intelligence Weave (Improved)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Intelligence saving throws increases by two steps (to proficient, from trained to expertise, from proficient to mastery, from expertise to high mastery, or from mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Interface Protocol
entries: You become a valid target for the {@spell tracker droid interface|orcnogSW5e} tech power.

item.name: Interfaced Assistance Protocol
entries: While you are interfaced via the {@spell tracker droid interface|orcnogSW5e} tech power, whenever your handler has advantage on an ability check or attack roll granted by you taking the {@action Help} action, they can reroll one of the dice once.

item.name: Interfaced Crafting Protocol
entries: While you are interfaced via the {@spell tracker droid interface|orcnogSW5e} tech power, whenever your handler makes an ability check using tools with which the you are also proficient, they have advantage on the check. If they already have advantage, they can instead reroll one of the dice once.

item.name: Interfaced Distraction Protocol
entries: While you are interfaced via the {@spell tracker droid interface|orcnogSW5e} tech power, when you are within 5 feet of a target, your handler does not provoke opportunity attacks when moving out of that creature's reach.

item.name: Interfaced Healing Protocol
entries: While you are interfaced via the {@spell tracker droid interface|orcnogSW5e} tech power, when your handler restores hit points to a creature that is within 5 feet of you, they can roll the dice twice and take either total.

item.name: Interfaced Tracking Protocol
entries: While you are interfaced via the {@spell tracker droid interface|orcnogSW5e} tech power, when your handler makes a Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) check to track a target, and you are also tracking that target, your handler gains advantage on the check. If they already have advantage, they can instead reroll one of the dice once.

item.name: Interlocking Shielding
entries: {@i {@b Prerequiste:} Shield}
This shield gains the interlocking 1 property. If it already has the interlocking property, its interlocking number increases by 1, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Interlocking Shielding Mk II
entries: {@i {@b Prerequiste:} Shield}
This shield gains the interlocking 2 property. If it already has the interlocking property, its interlocking number increases by 2, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Interlocking Shielding Mk III
entries: {@i {@b Prerequiste:} Shield}
This shield gains the interlocking 3 property. If it already has the interlocking property, its interlocking number increases to 3.

item.name: Intuitive Facial Prosthesis
entries: This augmentation replaces your face.

Your Intelligence score becomes 13. If your Intelligence score is already equal to or greater than 13, it has no effect on you. Additionally, you can add half your proficiency bonus (rounded down) to any Intelligence check you make that doesn't already include your proficiency bonus.

{@b Side Effect:} When you roll a 1 an Intelligence saving throw, the implant stutters, causing any ability checks in which you are proficient you make before the start of your next turn to not include your proficiency bonus.
{@i This facial prosthetic includes a solid state drive, allowing for quick recall.}

item.name: Investigator's Pattern (Basic)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Investigation} increases by one step (to trained, from trained to proficient, from proficient to expertise, from expertise to mastery, from mastery to high mastery, or from high mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Investigator's Pattern (Choice)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Investigation} increases by four steps (to mastery, from trained to high mastery, or from proficient to grand mastery).

item.name: Investigator's Pattern (Elite)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Investigation} increases by five steps (to high mastery or from trained to grand mastery).

item.name: Investigator's Pattern (Exquisite)
entries: You gain grand mastery in {@skill Investigation}.

item.name: Investigator's Pattern (Favored)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Investigation} increases by three steps (to expertise, from trained to mastery, from proficient to high mastery, or from expertise to grand mastery).

item.name: Investigator's Pattern (Fine)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Investigation} increases by two steps (to proficient, from trained to expertise, from proficient to mastery, from expertise to high mastery, or from mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Ion Amplifying Core
entries: This weapon ignores resistance to ion damage.

item.name: Iridonian Grav-lev Arm
entries: This augmentation replaces a hand.

Your unarmed strikes with this arm deal {@damage 1d4} ion damage, and your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift doubles. If it would already double, it instead triples. Additionally, you deal double damage to energy-based structures with your unarmed strikes.

{@b Side Effect:} You can no longer wield weapons with electronic components, such as blasters, vibroweapons, or lightweapons. Additionally, if this hand interacts with a small electronic device, such as a {@item datapad|orcnogSW5e} or {@item commlink|orcnogSW5e}, it is immediately disabled.

{@i This cybernetic arm replacement increases a user's physical strength and can be overloaded to release a unique field resonance discharge that is particularly effective against containment fields and makes holding on to hydrospanners a breeze.}

item.name: J-19 Bo-Rifle
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls with this enhanced weapon. Additionally, while it is in staff mode, the save DC for its shocking property increases to 14.
{@i This more recent and less artfully designed model of bo-rifle comes with a bayonet attached to the top edge.}

item.name: Jedi Knight's Robe
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to AC while you wear this robe.
{@i Members of the Order typically wear plain or unassuming garments, but this variant offers the additional protection needed by Jedi influencing important events.}

item.name: Jedi Master's Robe
entries: You gain a +3 bonus to AC while you wear this robe.
{@i Members of the Order typically wear plain or unassuming garments, but Jedi Masters also know the importance of adequate protection when great challenges must be surmounted.}

item.name: Jedi Padawan's Robe
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to AC while you wear this robe.
{@i Members of the Jedi Order typically wear plain or unassuming garments, offering only a minor boost to defenses.}

item.name: Jensaarai Armor
entries: While wearing this armor, you are considered proficient regardless of whether or not you have proficiency in medium armor. Additionally, it grants a +1 bonus to AC.

{@b {@i Jensaarai Regalia.}} While wearing and attuned to this armor and Jensaarai Cloak, you are adapted to both hot and cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide. Additionally, this armor now grants a +2 bonus to AC, instead of +1. While wearing and attuned to this armor, Jensaarai Cloak, and Jensaarai Headgear, this armor now grants a +3 bonus to AC, instead of +2.
{@i At the height of their training, Jensaarai craft and bond with their own armor. While each set of armor is unique to its bearer, they share similar traits.}

item.name: Jensaarai Cloak
entries: While wearing this cloak with its hood up, you can try to hide when you are lightly obscured from the creature from which you are hiding. Pulling the hood up or down requires a bonus action.

{@b {@i Jensaarai Regalia.}} While wearing and attuned to this cloak and Jensaarai Armor, while its hood is up, Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks made to see you have disadvantage, and you have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide. While wearing and attuned to this cloak, Jensaraai Armor, and Jensaarai Headgear, when you make a Dexterity saving throw to an avoid an effect that would deal cold, energy, fire, force, or kinetic damage, you can add your Wisdom or Charisma modifier (your choice, minimum of one) to the roll if it doesn't already include that modifier.
{@i Most Jensaari wear a gray cloak that subtly adapts to their surroundings.}

item.name: Jensaarai Headgear
entries: While you are wearing this headgear, kinetic and energy damage that you take from unenhanced weapons is reduced by an amount equal to your proficiency bonus.

{@b {@i Jensaarai Regalia.}} While wearing and attuned to this armor and Jensaarai Armor, this headgear no longer count towards your maximum attunement. While wearing and attuned to this headgear, Jensaarai Armor, and Jensaarai Cloak, fire, cold, and force damage you take is reduced by an amount equal to your proficiency bonus.
{@i Most Jensaarai craft a mask or helmet bearing the visage of an animal that best personifies their desires or goals.}

item.name: Jetpack
entries: Jetpacks are personal aerial transportation devices that allow the operator to fly into and through the air with great mobility. Activating or deactivating the jetpack requires a bonus action and, while active, you have a flying speed of 30 feet. The jetpack last for 1 minute per power cell (to a maximum of 10 minutes) and can be recharged by a power source or replacing the power cells.

item.name: Jetpack (Champion)
entries: Jetpacks are personal aerial transportation devices that allow the operator to fly into and through the air with great mobility. Activating or deactivating the jetpack requires a bonus action and, while active, you have a flying speed of 80 feet. The jetpack last for 1 minute per power cell (to a maximum of 20 minutes) and can be recharged by a power source or replacing the power cells.

item.name: Jetpack (Exceptional)
entries: Jetpacks are personal aerial transportation devices that allow the operator to fly into and through the air with great mobility. Activating or deactivating the jetpack requires a bonus action and, while active, you have a flying speed of 70 feet. The jetpack last for 1 minute per power cell (to a maximum of 18 minutes) and can be recharged by a power source or replacing the power cells.

item.name: Jetpack (Fine)
entries: Jetpacks are personal aerial transportation devices that allow the operator to fly into and through the air with great mobility. Activating or deactivating the jetpack requires a bonus action and, while active, you have a flying speed of 40 feet. The jetpack last for 1 minute per power cell (to a maximum of 12 minutes) and can be recharged by a power source or replacing the power cells.

item.name: Jetpack (Improved)
entries: Jetpacks are personal aerial transportation devices that allow the operator to fly into and through the air with great mobility. Activating or deactivating the jetpack requires a bonus action and, while active, you have a flying speed of 50 feet. The jetpack last for 1 minute per power cell (to a maximum of 14 minutes) and can be recharged by a power source or replacing the power cells.

item.name: Jetpack (Superior)
entries: Jetpacks are personal aerial transportation devices that allow the operator to fly into and through the air with great mobility. Activating or deactivating the jetpack requires a bonus action and, while active, you have a flying speed of 60 feet. The jetpack last for 1 minute per power cell (to a maximum of 16 minutes) and can be recharged by a power source or replacing the power cells.

item.name: Jug
entries: A jug stores 1 gallon of liquid.

item.name: Karrak
entries: A powerful painkiller, karrak allows creatures to continue through the most grievous injuries. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next minute, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d3} when making an ability check or saving throw using Constitution, and at the start of each of the creature's turns it gains {@dice 2d3} temporary hit points. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 10 minutes, during which they must roll a {@dice d3} and subtract the result when making an ability check or saving throw using Constitution, and for the duration their current and maximum hit points are reduced by {@dice 2d3}. If this would reduce your maximum hit points below 1, it instead becomes 1. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Karrak (Fine)
entries: A powerful painkiller, karrak allows creatures to continue through the most grievous injuries. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next minute, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d4} when making an ability check or saving throw using Constitution, and at the start of each of the creature's turns it gains {@dice 2d4} temporary hit points. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 1 hour, during which they must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the result when making an ability check or saving throw using Constitution, and for the duration their current and maximum hit points are reduced by {@dice 2d4}. If this would reduce your maximum hit points below 1, it instead becomes 1. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Karrak (High Quality)
entries: A powerful painkiller, karrak allows creatures to continue through the most grievous injuries. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next 10 minutes, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d8} when making an ability check or saving throw using Constitution, and at the start of each of the creature's turns it gains {@dice 2d8} temporary hit points. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 4 hours, during which they must roll a {@dice d8} and subtract the result when making an ability check or saving throw using Constitution, and for the duration their current and maximum hit points are reduced by {@dice 2d8}. If this would reduce your maximum hit points below 1, it instead becomes 1. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 20 Constitution saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Karrak (Potent)
entries: A powerful painkiller, karrak allows creatures to continue through the most grievous injuries. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next hour, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d10} when making an ability check or saving throw using Constitution, and at the start of each of the creature's turns it gains {@dice 2d10} temporary hit points. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 22 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 4 hours, during which they must roll a {@dice d10} and subtract the result when making an ability check or saving throw using Constitution, and for the duration their current and maximum hit points are reduced by {@dice 2d10}. If this would reduce your maximum hit points below 1, it instead becomes 1. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 22 Constitution saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Karrak (Pure)
entries: A powerful painkiller, karrak allows creatures to continue through the most grievous injuries. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next hour, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d12} when making an ability check or saving throw using Constitution, and at the start of each of the creature's turns it gains {@dice 2d12} temporary hit points. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 24 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 8 hours, during which they must roll a {@dice d12} and subtract the result when making an ability check or saving throw using Constitution, and for the duration their current and maximum hit points are reduced by {@dice 2d12}. If this would reduce your maximum hit points below 1, it instead becomes 1. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 24 Constitution throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Karrak (Uncut)
entries: A powerful painkiller, karrak allows creatures to continue through the most grievous injuries. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next 10 minutes, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d6} when making an ability check or saving throw using Constitution, and at the start of each of the creature's turns it gains {@dice 2d6} temporary hit points. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 1 hour, during which they must roll a {@dice d6} and subtract the result when making an ability check or saving throw using Constitution, and for the duration their current and maximum hit points are reduced by {@dice 2d6}. If this would reduce your maximum hit points below 1, it instead becomes 1. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Keen Beam
entries: This weapon gains the keen 1 property. If it already has the keen property, its keen number increases by 1, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Keen Beam (Deadly)
entries: This weapon gains the keen 2 property. If it already has the keen property, its keen number increases by 2, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Keen Beam (Devastating)
entries: This weapon gains the keen 3 property. If it already has the keen property, its keen number increases to 3.

item.name: Keen Core
entries: This weapon gains the keen 1 property. If it already has the keen property, its keen number increases by 1, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Keen Core (Deadly)
entries: This weapon gains the keen 2 property. If it already has the keen property, its keen number increases by 2, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Keen Core (Devastating)
entries: This weapon gains the keen 3 property. If it already has the keen property, its keen number increases to 3.

item.name: Keen Oscillator
entries: This weapon gains the keen 1 property. If it already has the keen property, its keen number increases by 1, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Keen Oscillator (Deadly)
entries: This weapon gains the keen 2 property. If it already has the keen property, its keen number increases by 2, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Keen Oscillator (Devastating)
entries: This weapon gains the keen 3 property. If it already has the keen property, its keen number increases to 3.

item.name: Krayt Dragon Pearl (Flawless)
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls made with this weapon. Additionally, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls you make with force powers when using this weapon as your focus. If the power would damage multiple targets, you can only apply this damage bonus to one of them.

item.name: Krayt Dragon Pearl (Perfect)
entries: You gain a +3 bonus to damage rolls made with this weapon. Additionally, you gain a +3 bonus to damage rolls you make with force powers when using this weapon as your focus. If the power would damage multiple targets, you can only apply this damage bonus to one of them.

item.name: Krayt Dragon Pearl (Regular)
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to damage rolls made with this weapon. Additionally, you gain a +1 bonus to damage rolls you make with force powers when using this weapon as your focus. If the power would damage multiple targets, you can only apply this damage bonus to one of them.

item.name: Lambent Shielding
entries: This shield gains the lambent property.

item.name: Leg Reinforcements
entries: When you make a long jump, you can cover a number of feet up to twice your Strength score. When you make a high jump, you can leap a number of feet up into the air equal to 3 + twice your Strength modifier.

item.name: Light Cell
entries: This weapon gains the light property.

item.name: Light Core
entries: This weapon gains the light property.

item.name: Light Oscillator
entries: This weapon gains the light property.

item.name: Lightning Cannon
entries: Whenever you deal damage with this weapon and roll the maximum on the weapon damage die, the creature hit becomes shocked until the end of its next turn.

item.name: Lightning Rifle
entries: Whenever you deal damage with this weapon and roll the maximum on the weapon damage die, the creature hit becomes shocked until the end of its next turn.

item.name: Lightweapon Chassis (Advanced)
entries: This modifiable lightweapon chassis comes with vacant modification slots for lightweapon modifications, as well as one augment slot. It can house modifications of advanced rarity or lower.

item.name: Lightweapon Chassis (Artifact)
entries: This modifiable lightweapon chassis comes with vacant modification slots for lightweapon modifications, as well as two augment slots. It can house modifications of artifact rarity or lower.

item.name: Lightweapon Chassis (Legendary)
entries: This modifiable lightweapon chassis comes with vacant modification slots for lightweapon modifications, as well as two augment slots. It can house modifications of legendary rarity or lower.

item.name: Lightweapon Chassis (Premium)
entries: This modifiable lightweapon chassis comes with vacant modification slots for lightweapon modifications. It can house modifications of premium rarity or lower.

item.name: Lightweapon Chassis (Prototype)
entries: This modifiable lightweapon chassis comes with vacant modification slots for lightweapon modifications, as well as one augment slot. It can house modifications of prototype rarity or lower.

item.name: Lightweapon Chassis (Standard)
entries: This modifiable lightweapon chassis comes with vacant modification slots for lightweapon modifications. It can house modifications of standard rarity.

item.name: Lightweight Reinforcement
entries: This armor or shield gains the lightweight property.

item.name: Lightweight Stabilizer Frame
entries: This weapon loses the two-handed property.

item.name: Loremaster's Pattern (Basic)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Lore} increases by one step (to trained, from trained to proficient, from proficient to expertise, from expertise to mastery, from mastery to high mastery, or from high mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Loremaster's Pattern (Choice)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Lore} increases by four steps (to mastery, from trained to high mastery, or from proficient to grand mastery).

item.name: Loremaster's Pattern (Elite)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Lore} increases by five steps (to high mastery or from trained to grand mastery).

item.name: Loremaster's Pattern (Exquisite)
entries: You gain grand mastery in {@skill Lore}.

item.name: Loremaster's Pattern (Favored)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Lore} increases by three steps (to expertise, from trained to mastery, from proficient to high mastery, or from expertise to grand mastery).

item.name: Loremaster's Pattern (Fine)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Lore} increases by two steps (to proficient, from trained to expertise, from proficient to mastery, from expertise to high mastery, or from mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Machinist's Catalyzer Mk I
entries: As an action, you can administer this catalyzer to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, the target gains a +1 bonus to its damage and healing rolls with tech powers. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one catalyzer at a time.

item.name: Machinist's Catalyzer Mk II
entries: As an action, you can administer this catalyzer to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, the target gains a +1 bonus to its tech attack rolls, tech save DC, and damage and healing rolls with tech powers. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one catalyzer at a time.

item.name: Machinist's Catalyzer Mk III
entries: As an action, you can administer this catalyzer to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, the target gains a +2 bonus to its tech attack rolls, tech save DC, and damage and healing rolls with tech powers. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one catalyzer at a time.

item.name: Machinist's Catalyzer Mk IV
entries: As an action, you can administer this catalyzer to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, the target gains a +3 bonus to its tech attack rolls, tech save DC, and damage and healing rolls with tech powers. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one catalyzer at a time.

item.name: Macrobinoculars
entries: Macrobinoculars are handheld viewing devices that allow users to observe distant objects. Some models are able to see into space from the surface of a planet.

item.name: Mag-lock Boots
entries: While you wear these boots, you can activate or deactivate heir mag-locks as a bonus action. While the mag locks are engaged, you move at half speed, can walk on any solid metallic surface, ignore {@quickref difficult terrain||3} caused by metallic debris, and ignore the effects of gravity (or the lack thereof), allowing you to walk up vertical surfaces or even upside-down.
The battery in these boots lasts for a total of 1 hour and recharges at the end of a long rest.

item.name: Magnetic Forearm Enhancement
entries: This augmentation replaces a forearm.
Unarmed strikes with this hand have the reach property.
{@b Side Effect:} When you roll a 1 on an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw with this arm, the hand disconnects and falls to the ground. It can be picked up and replaced as a bonus action.
{@i This hand replacement creates a magnetic connection between the hand and forearm, emitting a minor hum.}

item.name: Magnetic-Lock Grip
entries: While wielding this weapon, you have advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to disarm or avoid being disarmed.

item.name: Magnetized Shield
entries: This shield gains the magnetic 13 property. If it already has the magnetic property, its magnetic number increases by 1, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Magnetized Shield (Champion)
entries: This shield gains the magnetic 18 property. If it already has the magnetic property, its magnetic number increases to 18.

item.name: Magnetized Shield (Exceptional)
entries: This shield gains the magnetic 17 property. If it already has the magnetic property, its magnetic number increases by 5, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Magnetized Shield (Fine)
entries: This shield gains the magnetic 14 property. If it already has the magnetic property, its magnetic number increases by 2, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Magnetized Shield (Improved)
entries: This shield gains the magnetic 15 property. If it already has the magnetic property, its magnetic number increases by 3, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Magnetized Shield (Superior)
entries: This shield gains the magnetic 16 property. If it already has the magnetic property, its magnetic number increases by 4, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Manageability Armoring
entries: This armor loses the bulky property.

item.name: Mancatcher
entries: When you would make a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check to attempt to grapple a creature while wielding a weapon with the grappling property, you can instead make a melee weapon attack with it. If the attack hits, the creature becomes {@condition grappled} by you, and it takes damage equal to your Strength modifier of the same type as the weapon's damage.

item.name: Mandalorian Beskar'gam
entries: This armor comes equipped with 24 slots that can each hold a single item that weighs less than 2 lb. Additionally, it grants a +1 bonus to AC.

{@b {@i Mandalorian Vestments.}} While wearing and attuned to this armor and Mandalorian Helmet, you are able to survive and operate in zero gravity space and other dangerous conditions. Additionally, this armor now grants a +2 bonus to AC, instead of +1. While wearing and attuned to this armor, Mandalorian Helmet, and Mandalorian Shuk'orok, this armor now grants a +3 bonus to AC, instead of +2.
{@i This armor is forged from an incredibly rare material known as beskar, a highly durable metal.}

item.name: Mandalorian Helmet
entries: This helmet comes equipped with a @{item headcomm|orcnogSW5e} and holorecorder. Additionally, while wearing this helmet, you have {@sense darkvision} out to 60 feet.

{@b {@i Mandalorian Vestments.}} While wearing and attuned to this helmet and Mandalorian Beskar'gam, you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight within 60 feet. While wearing and attuned to this helmet, Mandalorian Beskar'gam, and Mandalorian Shuk'orok, you have advantage on Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) checks within 5 feet.
{@i Featuring the iconic T-shaped visor of the Mandalorians, this helmet strikes fear into the hearts of the unwary.}

item.name: Mandalorian Shuk'orok
entries: While wearing these gloves, your Strength score becomes 21. If your Strength is already equal to or greater than 21, it has no effect on you.

{@b {@i Mandalorian Vestments.}} While wearing and attuned to these gloves and Mandalorian Beskar'gam, these gauntlets no longer count towards your maximum attunement. While wearing and attuned to these gloves, Mandalorian Beskar'gam, and Mandalorian Helmet, you have resistance to kinetic and energy damage from unenhanced sources.
{@i The final piece of a Mandalorian's armor, these gauntlets grant augmented strength.}

item.name: Manipulator Upgrade
entries: You lose the Undersized special trait.

item.name: Mantle of the Anomic
entries: This item can hold a number of charges equal to half your sentinel level (rounded up). When you complete a long rest, this item regains all missing charges. When you would use a Force-Empowered Self option, you can expend charges instead of force points.
When you reach 5th level in sentinel, you can use two Force-Empowered Self options per hit, instead of only one.
When you reach 11th level in sentinel, you can use each Force-Empowered Self option twice per turn, instead of only once. You can still only use each option once per hit.
When you reach 17th level in sentinel, you can use your Enlightened Evasion feature for any saving throws, instead of just against effects that deal damage.
{@i This visually unremarkable mantle resists effects that would cause it to move or make noise.}

item.name: Maser Core
entries: When a creature tries to reduce the damage of a shot from this weapon with a feature or power, such as monk's Deflect Missiles or the {@spell saber reflect|orcnogSW5e} force power, they have disadvantage on the reduction roll.

item.name: Matrix Armor
entries: While wearing this suit of armor, any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit.
{@i This suit of armor has had its protective durasteel components replaced by equivalents made of matrix, a purple metal used to reinforce starships.}

item.name: Mechanic
entries: As an action, you can activate the repair tools, choosing one of the following options:

items: You can stabilize a droid within 5 feet of you that has 0 hit points, without needing to make an Intelligence ({@skill Technology}) check.
You can restore {@dice 2d4 + 2} hit points to a droid or construct within 5 feet.

entries: You can use each feature once. You regain all expended uses when you complete a long rest.
{@i This part equips the droid with a series of machine repair tools.}

item.name: Mechanic's kit
entries: Mechanic's kits are used to craft and repair vehicles and starships.

item.name: Medic
entries: As an action, you can activate the medical kit, choosing one of the following options:

items: You can stabilize a creature within 5 feet of you that has 0 hit points, without needing to make a Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check.
You can restore {@dice 1d4 + 1} hit points to a creature within 5 feet.
You can cure a target of one poison affecting them or to give them advantage on saving throws against poison for 1 hour.

entries: This medical kit has no effect on droids or constructs. You can use each feature once. You regain all expended uses when you complete a long rest.
{@i This part equips the droid with a compact medical kit.}

item.name: Medic's Pattern (Basic)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Medicine} increases by one step (to trained, from trained to proficient, from proficient to expertise, from expertise to mastery, from mastery to high mastery, or from high mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Medic's Pattern (Choice)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Medicine} increases by four steps (to mastery, from trained to high mastery, or from proficient to grand mastery).

item.name: Medic's Pattern (Elite)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Medicine} increases by five steps (to high mastery or from trained to grand mastery).

item.name: Medic's Pattern (Exquisite)
entries: You gain grand mastery in {@skill Medicine}.

item.name: Medic's Pattern (Favored)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Medicine} increases by three steps (to expertise, from trained to mastery, from proficient to high mastery, or from expertise to grand mastery).

item.name: Medic's Pattern (Fine)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Medicine} increases by two steps (to proficient, from trained to expertise, from proficient to mastery, from expertise to high mastery, or from mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Medpac
entries: A medpac is a quick-acting syringe filled with a concentrated dose of kolto. As an action, you can use this medpac to restore hit points to a beast or humanoid within 5 feet. The creature rolls one die equal to the size of their Hit Die and regains hit points equal to the amount rolled + their Constitution modifier (minimum of one hit point). If the creature has Hit Dice of different sizes, use whichever Hit Die size they have the most of.

item.name: Medpac (Champion)
entries: A medpac is a quick-acting syringe filled with a concentrated dose of kolto. As an action, you can use this medpac to restore hit points to a beast or humanoid within 5 feet. The creature rolls six dice equal to the size of their Hit Die and regains hit points equal to the amount rolled + their Constitution modifier (minimum of one hit point). If the creature has Hit Dice of different sizes, use whichever Hit Die size they have the most of.

item.name: Medpac (Exceptional)
entries: A medpac is a quick-acting syringe filled with a concentrated dose of kolto. As an action, you can use this medpac to restore hit points to a beast or humanoid within 5 feet. The creature rolls five dice equal to the size of their Hit Die and regains hit points equal to the amount rolled + their Constitution modifier (minimum of one hit point). If the creature has Hit Dice of different sizes, use whichever Hit Die size they have the most of.

item.name: Medpac (Fine)
entries: A medpac is a quick-acting syringe filled with a concentrated dose of kolto. As an action, you can use this medpac to restore hit points to a beast or humanoid within 5 feet. The creature rolls two dice equal to the size of their Hit Die and regains hit points equal to the amount rolled + their Constitution modifier (minimum of one hit point). If the creature has Hit Dice of different sizes, use whichever Hit Die size they have the most of.

item.name: Medpac (Improved)
entries: A medpac is a quick-acting syringe filled with a concentrated dose of kolto. As an action, you can use this medpac to restore hit points to a beast or humanoid within 5 feet. The creature rolls three dice equal to the size of their Hit Die and regains hit points equal to the amount rolled + their Constitution modifier (minimum of one hit point) If the creature has Hit Dice of different sizes, use whichever Hit Die size they have the most of.

item.name: Medpac (Superior)
entries: A medpac is a quick-acting syringe filled with a concentrated dose of kolto. As an action, you can use this medpac to restore hit points to a beast or humanoid within 5 feet. The creature rolls four dice equal to the size of their Hit Die and regains hit points equal to the amount rolled + their Constitution modifier (minimum of one hit point). If the creature has Hit Dice of different sizes, use whichever Hit Die size they have the most of.

item.name: MerenData Excelcior
entries: When you deal cold damage to a creature with a tech power cast through this wristpad, the creature gains 1 slowed level until the end of its next turn.

item.name: Mesh armor
entries: Providing solid protection for a minimal cost, mesh armor is considered excellent protection for entrenched troops or guards. However, this protection comes at a cost of mobility, limiting its uses by rapidly advancing infantry. Still, it provides more mobility than battle armor.

item.name: Mess kit
entries: This box contains a cup and simple cutlery. The box clamps together, and one side can be used as a cooking pan and the other as a plate or shallow bowl.

item.name: Microphasic Hypervisor
entries: This augmentation replaces your eyes.
You can activate or deactivate this implant as a bonus action. While active, you have {@sense truesight} to a range of 30 feet.
{@b Side Effect:} While active, you have disadvantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks beyond 30 feet.
{@i This augmentation is a large, boxy eye replacement that covers both eyes with digital optic feeds and high resolution sensors.}

item.name: Mighty Athlete Package
entries: Your Strength score increases by 1, and your maximum for this score increases by 1. Additionally, you have advantage on Strength saving throws.
{@b Side Effect:} One ability score other than Strength (chosen by the GM) decreases by 1.
{@i This implant drastically increases your physical capacities.}

item.name: Mighty Build
entries: Your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift doubles. If it would already double, it instead triples.

item.name: Mighty Core
entries: This weapon gains the mighty property.

item.name: Mine, Corrosive (Average)
entries: Mines can be set to detonate when a creature comes within up to 15 feet of it or paired with a remote detonator. As an action, you can prime and set a mine on a surface you can reach, which arms at the start of your next turn. When detonated, each creature within 15 feet of it must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 4d8} acid damage on a failed save, or half as much as on a successful one. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, it must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it dies immediately without making death saving throws. A disintegrated creature and everything unenhanced it is wearing or carrying are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. A creature destroyed in this way can not be revitalized.

item.name: Mine, Corrosive (Deadly)
entries: Mines can be set to detonate when a creature comes within up to 15 feet of it or paired with a remote detonator. As an action, you can prime and set a mine on a surface you can reach, which arms at the start of your next turn. When detonated, each creature within 15 feet of it must make a DC 20 Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 8d8} acid damage on a failed save, or half as much as on a successful one. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, it must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it dies immediately without making death saving throws. A disintegrated creature and everything unenhanced it is wearing or carrying are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. A creature destroyed in this way can not be revitalized.

item.name: Mine, Corrosive (Devastating)

item.name: Mine, Gas (Average)
entries: Mines can be set to detonate when a creature comes within up to 15 feet of it or paired with a remote detonator. As an action, you can prime and set a mine on a surface you can reach, which arms at the start of your next turn. When detonated, the mine fills the air in a 15-foot-radius sphere with yellow-green fog for 1 minute. The fog spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. It lasts for 1 minute or until a wind of at least 10 miles per hour disperses it.

When a creature enters the fog or starts its turn there, it creature must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. The creature takes {@damage 4d6} poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Additionally, on a failed save, the creature is {@condition poisoned} while it is in the cloud. Droids, constructs and humanoids wearing appropriate protective equipment are unaffected.

item.name: Mine, corrosive
entries: Mines can be set to detonate when a creature comes within up to 15 feet of it or paired with a remote detonator. When detonated, each creature within 15 feet of it must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 2d8} acid damage on a failed save, or half as much as on a successful one. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, it must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it dies immediately without making death saving throws. A disintegrated creature and everything unenhanced it is wearing or carrying are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. A creature destroyed in this way can not be revitalized.

item.name: Mine, incendiary

entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with this enhanced wrist launcher ammunition, which deals {@damage 1d6} kinetic damage on a hit.
