item.name: Mitigating Channel (Adept)
entries: This item gains the mitigating 4 property. If it already has the mitigating property, its mitigating number increases by 4, to a maximum of 6.

item.name: Mitigating Channel (Ancient)
entries: This item gains the mitigating 6 property. If it already has the mitigating property, its mitigating number increases to 6.

item.name: Mitigating Channel (Apprentice)
entries: This item gains the mitigating 2 property. If it already has the mitigating property, its mitigating number increases by 2, to a maximum of 6.

item.name: Mitigating Channel (Journeyman)
entries: This item gains the mitigating 3 property. If it already has the mitigating property, its mitigating number increases by 3, to a maximum of 6.

item.name: Mitigating Channel (Master)
entries: This item gains the mitigating 5 property. If it already has the mitigating property, its mitigating number increases by 5, to a maximum of 6.

item.name: Mitigating Channel (Novice)
entries: This item gains the mitigating 1 property. If it already has the mitigating property, its mitigating number increases by 1, to a maximum of 6.

item.name: Mitigating Processor Mk I
entries: This item gains the mitigating 1 property. If it already has the mitigating property, its mitigating number increases by 1, to a maximum of 6.

item.name: Mitigating Processor Mk II

entries: This item gains the mitigating 6 property. If it already has the mitigating property, its mitigating number increases to 6.

item.name: Monk Defensive Augment
entries: You gain one Monastic Vow option.

item.name: Monk Offensive Augment
entries: When you roll a 1 on the damage roll for an unarmed strike or monk weapon, you can reroll the die. You must use the new roll.

item.name: Monomolecular Oscillator Mk I
entries: This weapon ignores resistance to kinetic damage.

item.name: Monomolecular Oscillator Mk II
entries: This weapon ignores resistance to kinetic damage, and treats immunity as resistance.

item.name: Mortar Launcher
entries: Rather than traditional power cells, the mortar launcher fires grenades. If you lack proficiency in the mortar launcher, you must roll the damage dice twice and take the lesser total. A mortar launcher cannot fire on targets within its short range and when firing a grenade at long range, creatures within the radius of the grenade's explosion do not have advantage on the saving throw. Additionally, when you launch a mortar at a target, you can treat the Weapon's point of origin as being 200ft in the air for the purposes of determining line of sight and cover.

The mortar launcher requires the use of a tripod, which is included in the price. Over the course of 1 minute, you can deploy or collapse the mortar launcher on the tripod. While deployed, your speed is reduced to 0.

item.name: Multispectral Optics (Champion)
entries: While looking through this weapon's scope, you have {@sense truesight} out to a distance equal to the long range of this weapon and you can see creatures that are lightly or heavily obscured. Additionally, you gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls.

item.name: Mummergy
entries: Mummergy is a strong-smelling liquor derived from a plant of the same name. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next minute, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d3} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Intelligence. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 10 minutes, during which they must roll a {@dice d3} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Intelligence. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Mummergy (Aged)
entries: Mummergy is a strong-smelling liquor derived from a plant of the same name. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next 10 minutes, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d8} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Intelligence. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 4 hours, during which they must roll a {@dice d8} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Intelligence. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

entries: Mummergy is a strong-smelling liquor derived from a plant of the same name. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. item.name: Munitions kit
entries: Munitions kits are used to create ammunition for blasters, as well as devices to hone lightweapons and vibroweapons.

item.name: Muon Gold (Fine)
entries: Muon gold is a lubricant-based spice that gives users intensified mental clarity and focus for a short time. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next minute, the creature experiences a high that increases their current and maximum tech points by {@dice 2d4}. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 1 hour, their current and maximum tech points are reduced by {@dice 2d4}. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Muon Gold (Pure)
entries: Muon gold is a lubricant-based spice that gives users intensified mental clarity and focus for a short time. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next hour, the creature experiences a high that increases their current and maximum tech points by {@dice 2d12}. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 24 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 8 hours, their current and maximum tech points are reduced by {@dice 2d12}. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 24 Constitution saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Muon Gold (Uncut)
entries: Muon gold is a lubricant-based spice that gives users intensified mental clarity and focus for a short time. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next 10 minutes, the creature experiences a high that increases their current and maximum tech points by {@dice 2d6}. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 1 hour, their current and maximum tech points are reduced by {@dice 2d6}. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Muon gold
entries: Muon gold is a lubricant-based spice that gives users intensified mental clarity and focus for a short time. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next minute, the creature experiences a high that increases their current and maximum tech points by {@dice 2d3}. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 10 minutes, their current and maximum tech points are reduced by {@dice 2d3}. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Nagai Edge (Basic)
entries: When you have advantage on an attack roll you make with this weapon, get the same result on both dice rolls, and hit, you deal one additional weapon die worth of damage.

item.name: Nagai Edge (Exceptional)
entries: When you have advantage on an attack roll you make with this weapon, get the same result on both dice rolls, and hit, you deal three additional weapon dice worth of damage.

item.name: Nagai Edge (Improved)
entries: When you have advantage on an attack roll you make with this weapon, get the same result on both dice rolls, and hit, you deal two additional weapon dice worth of damage.

item.name: Naturalist's Pattern (Basic)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Nature} increases by one step (to trained, from trained to proficient, from proficient to expertise, from expertise to mastery, from mastery to high mastery, or from high mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Naturalist's Pattern (Choice)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Nature} increases by four steps (to mastery, from trained to high mastery, or from proficient to grand mastery).

item.name: Naturalist's Pattern (Elite)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Nature} increases by five steps (to high mastery or from trained to grand mastery).

item.name: Naturalist's Pattern (Exquisite)
entries: You gain grand mastery in {@skill Nature}.

item.name: Naturalist's Pattern (Favored)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Nature} increases by three steps (to expertise, from trained to mastery, from proficient to high mastery, or from expertise to grand mastery).

item.name: Naturalist's Pattern (Fine)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Nature} increases by two steps (to proficient, from trained to expertise, from proficient to mastery, from expertise to high mastery, or from mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Necklace of Determination
entries: This item can hold a number of charges equal to half your monk level (rounded up). When you complete a long rest, this item regains all missing charges. When you would expend a focus point, you can instead expend a charge.
When you reach 5th level in monk, when you use your Slow Fall feature, the amount is increased to ten times your monk level, instead of five.
When you reach 11th level in monk, when you use your Deflect Missiles feature, you can add your Wisdom or Charisma modifier to the roll (your choice, a minimum of +1).
When you reach 17th level in monk, you can add half your Dexterity modifier (rounded down) to your focus save DC and focus attack modifier.
{@i This simple necklace comprised of a series of tiny gray beads hosts a single pale blue crystal that glows faintly.}

item.name: Needler
entries: The needler includes a specialized compartment for poison. One dose of poison, when installed in this compartment, retains its potency for 1 hour before drying. One dose of poison is effective for the next 10 shots fired by the weapon.

item.name: Net
entries: A Large or smaller creature hit by a net is {@condition restrained} until it is freed. A net has no effect on formless or Huge or larger creatures. A creature can use its action to make a DC 13 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. The net has an AC of 10, 5 hit points, and immunity to all damage not dealt by melee weapons. Destroying the net frees the creature without harming it and immediately ends the net's effects. While a creature is {@condition restrained} by a net, you can make no further attacks with it.

entries: A Large or smaller creature hit by a net is {@condition restrained} until it is freed. A net has no effect on formless or Huge or larger creatures. The net has an AC of 15, 30 hit points, immunity to all damage not dealt by melee weapons, and resistance to damage dealt by unenhanced melee weapons. Destroying the net frees the creature without harming it and immediately ends the net's effects. While a creature is {@condition restrained} by a net, you can make no further attacks with it.

item.name: Nighthawk Ocular Implant
entries: This augmentation replaces your eyes.
You can activate or deactivate this implant as a bonus action. While active, you gain {@sense darkvision} to a range of 120 feet.
{@b Side Effect:} While active and in bright light, you have disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

entries: Your Sneak Attack damage die increases by one step (from {@dice d6} to a {@dice d8}, {@dice d8} to {@dice d10}, or {@dice d10} to {@dice d12}).

item.name: Optimized Actuators Mk I
entries: Your movement speed increases by 5 feet.

item.name: Orbalisk Armor
entries: This armor has no weight and does not affect encumbrance. While wearing it, you are considered proficient regardless of whether or not you have proficiency with heavy armor, and you are resistant to all unenhanced damage.

{@b {@i Cursed.}} You can not remove this armor without first killing the orbalisks. While wearing this armor, whenever you complete a long rest, you must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. You can choose to fail this saving throw. For each saving throw you fail, the size of your Hit Die is reduced by one step (from {@dice d12} to {@dice d10}, from {@dice d10} to {@dice d8}, from {@dice d8} to {@dice d6}, from {@dice d6} to {@dice d4}, or from {@dice d4} to {@dice d2}). If you fail a saving throw while your Hit Die is a {@dice d2}, you die as the orbalisks consume you. Additionally, for each saving throw you fail, your AC increases by 1. For each saving throw you succeed, the size of your Hit Die increases by one step (from {@dice d2} to {@dice d4}, from {@dice d4} to {@dice d6}, from {@dice d6} to {@dice d8}, from {@dice d8} to {@dice d10}, or from {@dice d10} to {@dice d12}). Additionally, for each saving throw you succeed, your AC decreases by 1. The size of your Hit Die can not exceed the Hit Dice granted by your class, and your AC can not be increased or reduced more than the number of Hit Die increases or reductions.
{@i This armor is comprised of a series of small parasitic creatures called orbalisks. Over time, orbalisks reproduce until they cover the entirety of their host.}

item.name: Overload Shield
entries: You modify this shield generator to overload. As an action you can overload this shield. Each Large or smaller creature within 5 feet of you must make a DC 13 Dexterity or Strength saving throw (their choice). On a failed save, they are pushed back 5 feet and knocked {@condition prone}.
You can use this feature twice. You regain all expended uses when you complete a short or long rest.

item.name: Panic Dart (Average)
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this wrist launcher dart, which deals {@damage 1d6} kinetic damage on a hit. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the dart has been fired, it no longer gives a bonus. Also on a hit, the creature must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw, taking {@damage 1d4} psychic damage on a failed save.
Additionally, on a failed save, a creature becomes {@condition frightened} of you for 1 minute. At the start of an affected creature's turn, it can repeat this save, ending the effect on a success.

Additionally, on a failed save, a creature becomes {@condition frightened} of you for 1 minute. At the start of an affected creature's turn, it can repeat this save, ending the effect on a success.

item.name: Panic calibrator
entries: As an action, you can apply this calibrator to one vibroweapon or pair of handwraps within 5 feet, granting it a +1 bonus to damage rolls for 1 minute. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Additionally, for the duration, the weapon gains the neuralizing 13 property. If it already has the neuralizing property, its neuralizing number increases by 1, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Panic collimator
entries: As an action, you can apply this collimator to one lightweapon within 5 feet, granting it a +1 bonus to damage rolls for 1 minute. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Additionally, for the duration, the weapon gains the neuralizing 13 property. If it already has the neuralizing property, its neuralizing number increases by 1, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Panic dart
entries: This wrist launcher ammunition deals {@damage 1d6} kinetic damage on a hit. Also on a hit, the creature must make a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw, taking {@damage 1d4} psychic damage on a failed save.
Additionally, on a failed save, a creature becomes {@condition frightened} of you for 1 minute. At the start of an affected creature's turn, it can repeat this save, ending the effect on a success.

item.name: Pants Chassis (Advanced)
entries: This modifiable clothing chassis comes with vacant modification slots for clothing modifications, as well as one augment slot. It can house modifications of advanced rarity or lower.

item.name: Pants Chassis (Artifact)
entries: This modifiable clothing chassis comes with vacant modification slots for clothing modifications, as well as two augment slots. It can house modifications of artifact rarity or lower.

item.name: Pants Chassis (Legendary)
entries: This modifiable clothing chassis comes with vacant modification slots for clothing modifications, as well as two augment slots. It can house modifications of legendary rarity or lower.

item.name: Pants Chassis (Premium)
entries: This modifiable clothing chassis comes with vacant modification slots for clothing modifications. It can house modifications of premium rarity or lower.

item.name: Pants Chassis (Prototype)
entries: This modifiable clothing chassis comes with vacant modification slots for clothing modifications, as well as one augment slot. It can house modifications of prototype rarity or lower.

item.name: Pants Chassis (Standard)
entries: This modifiable clothing chassis comes with vacant modification slots for clothing modifications. It can house modifications of standard rarity.

item.name: Pauldron of Retribution
entries: This item can hold a number of charges equal to half your berserker level (rounded up). When you complete a long rest, this item regains all missing charges. While raging, when you deal damage that would include your Rage Damage, you can expend one charge to double your Rage Damage bonus for that damage.
When you reach 5th level in berserker, when you use your Reckless {@action Attack} feature, your critical hit range increases by 1.
When you reach 11th level in berserker, once per critical hit, when you roll maximum damage on a weapon damage die, you can roll an additional die and add both to the total.

When you reach 17th level in berserker, when you are conscious and fail a Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution saving throw, you can choose to instead succeed. Once you've done so, you must complete a short or long rest before you can do so again.
{@i This single pauldron, which can be worn over armor, features the visage of a howling beast.}

item.name: Perceptive Pattern (Basic)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Perception} increases by one step (to trained, from trained to proficient, from proficient to expertise, from expertise to mastery, from mastery to high mastery, or from high mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Perceptive Pattern (Elite)

item.name: Personal translator
entries: A personal translator is a hand held device that can translate verbal communications between up to five languages. The languages can be changed out while interfaced with a protocol droid or appropriate computer.

item.name: Phobium Echoer (Improved)
entries: When you cast a force power that affects an area in a radius or a cube, you can increase the radius or length of the cube by 5 feet.

item.name: Phobium Echoer (Superior)
entries: When you cast a force power that affects an area in a radius or a cube, you can increase the radius or length of the cube by 10 feet.

item.name: Physical Barrier Mk I
entries: As an action, you can administer this barrier to a creature within 5 feet. The barrier has 10 hit points, and lasts 8 hours. Whenever the creature takes damage (one of energy, ion, or kinetic, chosen by the GM when the item is created), the barrier takes the damage instead. If this damage reduces the barrier to 0 hit points, the creature takes any remaining damage. A creature can benefit from only one barrier at a time.

If this damage reduces the barrier to 0 hit points, the creature takes any remaining damage. A creature can benefit from only one barrier at a time.

item.name: Pocket scrambler
entries: A pocket scrambler is a simple add-on to any @{item commlink|orcnogSW5e} that automatically encodes any messages sent out. The transmitted message can only be read by a device equipped with a matched scrambler.

item.name: Poison
entries: As an action, you can use the poison in this vial to coat one vibroweapon, one slug cartridge, or one wrist launcher dart. A creature hit by the {@condition poisoned} weapon must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 2d4} poison damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. Once applied, the poison retains potency for 1 minute before drying.

item.name: Portable Teleporter Mk I
entries: As an action, you can use this teleporter to create a pair of linked portals: one portal appears in a space within 5 feet of you, and the other portal appears in an unoccupied space you can see up to 30 feet away. These portals lasts until the start of your next turn, and they are large enough to accommodate Medium and smaller creatures and objects. Portals take the appearance of an elongated, shimmering mirror, and looking through a portal, a creature can see through the linked portal as if looking through a window. A creature or object who passes through a portal immediately appears in a space within 5 feet of the linked portal.

entries: As an action, you can use this teleporter to create a pair of linked portals: one portal appears in a space within 5 feet of you, and the other portal appears in an unoccupied space you can see up to 60 feet away. item.name: Pot

item.name: Pouch

item.name: Power Cell (Average)
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced power cell. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the power cell is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Power Cell (Deadly)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced power cell. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the power cell is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Power Cell (Devastating)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack rolls and deal an additional {@damage 1d10} damage with this enhanced power cell. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the power cell is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Power Cell (Lethal)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack rolls and deal an additional {@damage 1d8} damage with this enhanced power cell. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the power cell is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Power Cell (Major)
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced power cell. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the power cell is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Power Generator (Lethal)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack rolls and deal an additional {@damage 1d8} damage with this enhanced power generator. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the torpedo is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Power Generator (Major)

item.name: Power Supply Port
entries: You gain the ability to charge expended power cells and power generators within your reach. You have a charging capacity of 1 hour. You can spend 10 minutes of this charging capacity to replenish an expended power cell, or 1 hour replenishing an expended power generator. Alternatively, you can directly connect to and power a single blaster weapon that uses power cells or power generators. Once per turn, if the powered weapon would be reloaded, it can be done without using an action, instead expending 10 minutes of your charging capacity if it uses power cells or 1 hour if it uses a power generator. Connecting or disconnecting a weapon takes an action.
If you attempt to replenish an enhanced power cell or power generator, or a specialized power cell, it loses its enhanced or specialized properties.

item.name: Power belt
entries: This belt has slots to hold six power cells, and can be connected to directly power a single blaster weapon that uses power cells. Once per turn, if the powered weapon would be reloaded, it can be done without using an action using any ammunition in the belt. Connecting or disconnecting a weapon takes an action. Replacing an expended power cell takes an action.

item.name: Power cell
entries: Weapons with this property are fueled by power cells, which must be loaded in order to fire the weapon.

item.name: Power generator
entries: Power generators energize the rotary cannon.

item.name: Powered Armoring Mk IV

item.name: Powered Armoring Mk V

item.name: Powered Armoring Mk VI

item.name: Processing Amplifier (Dueling)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +2 bonus to melee tech attacks.

item.name: Processing Amplifier (Fighting)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +1 bonus to melee tech attacks.

item.name: Processing Amplifier (Mastery)

item.name: Projector Canister, Corrosive (Average)
entries: When triggered, this enhanced wrist launcher ammunition produces a spray of acid in a line 15 feet long and 5 feet wide or a 15-foot cone. A single fuel canister holds enough fuel for three attacks in a line or a single attack in a cone. Each creature must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d6} acid damage, and the first attack it makes before the end of its next turn has disadvantage. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and isn't disadvantaged. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, it must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it dies immediately without making death saving throws. A disintegrated creature and everything it is wearing and carrying are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. If you lack proficiency in the wrist launcher, you must roll the damage dice twice and take the lesser total.

item.name: Projector Canister, Cryo (Major)
entries: When triggered, this enhanced wrist launcher ammunition produces a beam of carbonite energy in a line 15 feet long and 5 feet wide or a 15-foot cone. A single fuel canister holds enough fuel for three attacks in a line or a single attack in a cone. Each creature must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 3d4} cold damage and gains 1 slowed level until the end of your next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and isn't slowed. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, that creature is frozen in carbonite for 1 hour. If you lack proficiency in the wrist launcher, you must roll the damage dice twice and take the lesser total.

item.name: Projector Canister, Incendiary (Average)
entries: When triggered, this enhanced wrist launcher ammunition produces a burst of flame in a line 15 feet long and 5 feet wide or a 15-foot cone. A single fuel canister holds enough fuel for three attacks in a line or a single attack in a cone. Each creature must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 2d8} fire damage or half as much on a successful one. The fire spreads around corners. It ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried. If you lack proficiency in the wrist launcher, you must roll the damage dice twice and take the lesser total.

item.name: Projector Canister, Incendiary (Deadly)
entries: When triggered, this enhanced wrist launcher ammunition produces a burst of flame in a line 15 feet long and 5 feet wide or a 15-foot cone. A single fuel canister holds enough fuel for three attacks in a line or a single attack in a cone. Each creature must make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 4d8} fire damage or half as much on a successful one. The fire spreads around corners. It ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried. If you lack proficiency in the wrist launcher, you must roll the damage dice twice and take the lesser total.

item.name: Projector Tank, Corrosive (Average)
entries: When triggered, this enhanced vapor projector ammunition produces a spray of acid in a line 15 feet long and 5 feet wide or a 15-foot cone. A single fuel tank holds enough fuel for three attacks in a line or a single attack in a cone. Each creature must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d6} acid damage, and the first attack it makes before the end of its next turn has disadvantage. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and isn't disadvantaged. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, it must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it dies immediately without making death saving throws. A disintegrated creature and everything it is wearing and carrying are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust.

item.name: Propulsion pack
entries: Propulsion packs enhance underwater movement. Activating or deactivating the propulsion pack requires a bonus action and, while active, you have a swimming speed of 30 feet. The propulsion pack lasts for 1 minute per power cell (to a maximum of 10 minutes) and can be recharged by a power source or replacing the power cells.

item.name: Quantum Splitter Mk I
entries: When you deal damage with this weapon, you can roll a {@dice d4} and add the result to the total.

item.name: Quantum Splitter Mk II
entries: When you deal damage with this weapon, you can roll a {@dice d6} and add the result to the total.

item.name: Quantum Splitter Mk III
entries: When you deal damage with this weapon, you can roll a {@dice d8} and add the result to the total.

item.name: Quantum Splitter Mk IV
entries: When you deal damage with this weapon, you can roll a {@dice d10} and add the result to the total.

item.name: Quick Savant Package
entries: Your Intelligence score increases by 1, and your maximum for this score increases by 1. Additionally, you have advantage on Intelligence saving throws.
{@b Side Effect:} One ability score other than Intelligence (chosen by the GM) decreases by 1.
{@i This implant drastically increases your mental capacities.}

item.name: Quick-Fingered Pattern (Basic)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Sleight of Hand} increases by one step (to trained, from trained to proficient, from proficient to expertise, from expertise to mastery, from mastery to high mastery, or from high mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Quick-Fingered Pattern (Choice)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Sleight of Hand} increases by four steps (to mastery, from trained to high mastery, or from proficient to grand mastery).

item.name: Quick-Fingered Pattern (Elite)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Sleight of Hand} increases by five steps (to high mastery or from trained to grand mastery).

item.name: Quick-Fingered Pattern (Exquisite)
entries: You gain grand mastery in {@skill Sleight of Hand}.

item.name: Quick-Fingered Pattern (Favored)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Sleight of Hand} increases by three steps (to expertise, from trained to mastery, from proficient to high mastery, or from expertise to grand mastery).

item.name: Quick-Fingered Pattern (Fine)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Sleight of Hand} increases by two steps (to proficient, from trained to expertise, from proficient to mastery, from expertise to high mastery, or from mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Quiver
entries: A quiver which can hold up to 20 arrows, 10 bolts, or 10 darts. Drawing an item from the quiver does not require an object interaction.

item.name: RZ-3 Extender Frame
entries: This weapon gains the reach property.

item.name: Raava
entries: Raava is a traditional liquor breed from zsajhira berries. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next minute, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d3} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Dexterity. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 10 minutes, during which they must roll a {@dice d3} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Dexterity. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Raava (Aged)
entries: Raava is a traditional liquor breed from zsajhira berries. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next 10 minutes, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d8} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Dexterity. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 4 hours, during which they must roll a {@dice d8} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Dexterity. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Raava (Fine)
entries: Raava is a traditional liquor breed from zsajhira berries. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next minute, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d4} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Dexterity. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 1 hour, during which they must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Dexterity. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Raava (Matured)
entries: Raava is a traditional liquor breed from zsajhira berries. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next 10 minutes, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d6} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Dexterity. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 1 hour, during which they must roll a {@dice d6} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Dexterity. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Raava (Reserve)
entries: Raava is a traditional liquor breed from zsajhira berries. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next hour, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d10} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Dexterity. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 22 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 4 hours, during which they must roll a {@dice d10} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Dexterity. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 22 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Raava (Special)
entries: Raava is a traditional liquor breed from zsajhira berries. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next hour, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d12} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Dexterity. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 24 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 8 hours, during which they must roll a {@dice d12} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Dexterity. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 24 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Ram, portable
entries: You can use a portable ram to break down doors. When doing so, you gain a +4 bonus on the Strength check. One other character can help you use the ram, giving you advantage on this check.

item.name: Ranging Dataport (Ascendancy)
entries: This item gains the ranging 3 property. If it already has the ranging property, its ranging number increases to 3.

item.name: Ranging Dataport (Fighting)
entries: This item gains the ranging 1 property. If it already has the ranging property, its ranging number increases by 1, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Ranging Dataport (Mastery)
entries: This item gains the ranging 2 property. If it already has the ranging property, its ranging number increases by 2, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Ranging Emitter (Ascendancy)
entries: This item gains the ranging 3 property. If it already has the ranging property, its ranging number increases to 3.

item.name: Ranging Emitter (Fighting)
entries: This item gains the ranging 1 property. If it already has the ranging property, its ranging number increases by 1, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Ranging Emitter (Mastery)
entries: This item gains the ranging 2 property. If it already has the ranging property, its ranging number increases by 2, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Rapid Core
entries: This weapon gains the rapid property, with a rapid number equal to one-half its reload number (rounded up), to a minimum of 2. If it already has the rapid property, the rapid number is reduced to one-fourth its reload number (rounded up), to a minimum of 2.

item.name: Rapid Core (Champion)
entries: This weapon gains the rapid property, with a rapid number equal to one-eighth its reload number (rounded up), to a minimum of 2. If it already has the rapid property, the rapid number is reduced to one-sixteenth its reload number (rounded up), to a minimum of 2.

item.name: Rapid Core (Superior)
entries: This weapon gains the rapid property, with a rapid number equal to one-fourth its reload number (rounded up), to a minimum of 2. If it already has the rapid property, the rapid number is reduced to one-eighth its reload number (rounded up), to a minimum of 2.

item.name: Reactive Armoring
entries: This armor gains the reactive 1 property. If it already has the reactive property, its reactive number increases by 1, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Reactive Armoring Mk II
entries: This armor gains the reactive 2 property. If it already has the reactive property, its reactive number increases by 2, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Reactive Armoring Mk III
entries: This armor gains the reactive 3 property. If it already has the reactive property, its reactive number increases to 3.

item.name: Reactive Ultrachrome Armor
entries: You have resistence to unenhanced damage while you wear this armor. Additionally, you can use an action to make yourself immune to unenhanced damage for 10 minutes or until you are no longer wearing the armor. Once this special action is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

{@i Made with just enough ultrachrome to give you an edge while still keeping things interesting, these suits of armor can discharge an integrated power cell to catalyze this metal normally used in starship hulls into a more resilient state.}

item.name: Recoil Dampener
entries: This weapon's strength number is reduced by one step (from 21 to 19, 19 to 17, 17 to 15, 15 to 13, or 13 to 11). If the strength number is 11, this modification removes the strength property from it entirely.

item.name: Recoil Dampener (Champion)
entries: This weapon loses the strength property.

item.name: Recoil Dampener (Exceptional)
entries: This weapon's strength number is reduced by five steps (from 21 to 11). If the strength number is 19 or lower, this modification removes the strength property from it entirely.

item.name: Recoil Dampener (Fine)
entries: This weapon's strength number is reduced by two steps (from 21 to 17, 19 to 15, 17 to 13, or 15 to 11). If the strength number is 13 or lower, this modification removes the strength property from it entirely.

item.name: Recoil Dampener (Improved)
entries: This weapon's strength number is reduced by three steps (from 21 to 15, 19 to 13, or 17 to 11). If the strength number is 15 or lower, this modification removes the strength property from it entirely.

item.name: Recoil Dampener (Superior)
entries: This weapon's strength number is reduced by four steps (from 21 to 13 or 19 to 11). If the strength number is 17 or lower, this modification removes the strength property from it entirely.

item.name: Reflex Enhancer Mk I
entries: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Intelligence saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on a saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.
{@b Side Effect:} When you fail a Intelligence saving throw, you treat the damage as if the source had rolled the maximum.

item.name: Reflex Enhancer Mk II
entries: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on a saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.
{@b Side Effect:} When you fail a Dexterity saving throw, you treat the damage as if the source had rolled the maximum.

item.name: Reflex Enhancer Mk III
entries: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity or Intelligence saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on a saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.
{@b Side Effect:} When you fail a Dexterity or Intelligence saving throw, you treat the damage as if the source had rolled the maximum.

item.name: Reflex Protocol Mk I
entries: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Intelligence saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on a saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

item.name: Reflex Protocol Mk II
entries: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on a saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

item.name: Reflex Protocol Mk III
entries: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity or Intelligence saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on a saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

item.name: Regulated Reinforcement
entries: This armor or shield gains the regulated property.

item.name: Reinforced Armoring
entries: This armor gains the reinforced property.

item.name: Reinforced Chassis
entries: You've reinforced your chassis. When you don't have armor integrated, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier.

item.name: Reinforced Underlay (Basic)
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to AC against ranged attacks and a -1 penalty to AC against melee attacks while wearing this armor or wielding this shield.

item.name: Reinforced Underlay (Fine)
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to AC against ranged attacks while wearing this armor or wielding this shield.

item.name: Reinforced Underlay (Improved)
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to AC against ranged attacks while wearing this armor or wielding this shield.

item.name: Reinforced Underlay (Superior)
entries: You gain a +3 bonus to AC against ranged attacks while wearing this armor or wielding this shield.

item.name: Remote Detonator (Champion)
entries: A small handhold device with a single button, used to activate explosives. Over the course of 1 minute, you can pair the detonator with up to 12 mines within 10 feet. As an action, you can remotely detonate all of the paired mines. You must be within 1,000 feet of the mines to detonate them.

item.name: Remote Detonator (Exceptional)
entries: A small handhold device with a single button, used to activate explosives. Over the course of 1 minute, you can pair the detonator with up to ten mines within 10 feet. As an action, you can remotely detonate all of the paired mines. You must be within 300 feet of the mines to detonate them.

item.name: Remote Detonator (Fine)
entries: A small handhold device with a single button, used to activate explosives. Over the course of 1 minute, you can pair the detonator with up to four mines within 10 feet. As an action, you can remotely detonate all of the paired mines. You must be within 60 feet of the mines to detonate them.

item.name: Remote Detonator (Improved)
entries: A small handhold device with a single button, used to activate explosives. Over the course of 1 minute, you can pair the detonator with up to six mines within 10 feet. As an action, you can remotely detonate all of the paired mines. You must be within 90 feet of the mines to detonate them.

item.name: Remote Detonator (Superior)
entries: A small handhold device with a single button, used to activate explosives. Over the course of 1 minute, you can pair the detonator with up to eight mines within 10 feet. As an action, you can remotely detonate all of the paired mines. You must be within 150 feet of the mines to detonate them.

item.name: Remote detonator
entries: A small handhold device with a single button, used to activate explosives. Over the course of 1 minute, you can pair the detonator with up to two mines within 10 feet. As an action, you can remotely detonate all of the paired mines. You must be within 30 feet of the mines to detonate them.

item.name: Repair Kit Mk II
entries: A repair kit included the basic tools needed to repair a droid after being damaged in combat. The kit has three uses. As an action, you can expend one use of the kit to restore hit points to a droid or construct within 5 feet. The creature rolls two dice equal to the size of their Hit Die and regains hit points equal to the amount rolled + their Constitution modifier (minimum of one hit point). If the creature has Hit Dice of different sizes, use whichever Hit Die size they have the most of.

entries: A repair kit included the basic tools needed to repair a droid after being damaged in combat. The kit has three uses. As an action, you can expend one use of the kit to restore hit points to a droid or construct within 5 feet. The creature rolls three dice equal to the size of their Hit Die and regains hit points equal to the amount rolled + their Constitution modifier (minimum of one hit point). If the creature has Hit Dice of different sizes, use whichever Hit Die size they have the most of.

item.name: Repelling Cycler (Chipped)
entries: This item gains the repelling property, but the DC to interrupt or dispel your powers is equal to 10 + the power's level, or 8 + your proficiency bonus + your casting modifier for that power, whichever is greater.

item.name: Repelling Cycler (Cracked)
entries: This item gains the repelling property.

item.name: Repelling Cycler (Flawed)
entries: This item gains the repelling property, but the DC to interrupt or dispel your powers is equal to 10 + the power's level, or 8 + twice your proficiency bonus + your casting modifier for that power, whichever is greater.

item.name: Repelling Cycler (Flawless)
entries: This item gains the repelling property, but the DC to interrupt or dispel your powers is equal to 10 + the power's level, or 8 + twice your proficiency bonus + your casting modifier for that power, whichever is greater. Additionally, creatures always have disadvantage on ability checks to dispel or interrupt your powers, and when a creatures make an ability check to dispel or interrupt your powers with disadvantage, they must reroll one of the dice once (your choice).

entries: This wristpad has the repelling and constitution 11 properties.

item.name: Repulsor Lifts (Basic)
entries: Repulsor lifts are a form of rocket propulsion affixed to the lower part of a droid's chassis. Activating or deactivating the repulsors requires a bonus action and, while active, you have a flying speed of 25 feet. The repulsor lifts last for 1 minute. Once they've been used, they can't be used again until an hour has passed.

item.name: Repulsor pack
entries: Repulsor packs are used to slow descent from a high elevation. Activating or deactivating the repulsor pack requires a bonus action and, while active, your rate of descent slow to 60 feet per round, and you ignore the effects of wind of less than moderate speed (no more than 10 mph). The repulsor pack lasts for 1 minute per power cell (to a maximum of 10 minutes) and can be recharged by a power source or replacing the power cells.

item.name: Resourceful Drive
entries: Your speed increases by 5 feet, and you gain proficiency in one blaster or vibroweapon of your choice.

item.name: Respiration Facilitator
entries: You have advantage on Constitution saving throws against force powers.
{@i This choker allowed the notorious bounty hunter Cad Bane to bypass normal respiratory function. While worn, it gives your a voice a deeper, digital sound.}

item.name: Respirator
entries: A respirator, or breath mask, is a portable device that allowed an oxygen-breather to survive in low-oxygen atmospheres. Although not suitable for use in outer-space, these hands-free masks were essential equipment for deep-space travel that might require activity outside of a starship.

item.name: Responsive Shielding Mk I
entries: {@i {@b Prerequiste:} Shield}
This shield gains the responsive 1 property. If it already has the responsive property, its responsive number increases by 1, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Responsive Shielding Mk II
entries: {@i {@b Prerequiste:} Shield}
This shield gains the responsive 2 property. If it already has the responsive property, its responsive number increases by 2, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Responsive Shielding Mk III

This shield gains the responsive 3 property. If it already has the responsive property, its responsive number increases to 3.

item.name: Restraining Bolt (Champion)
entries: Restraining bolts are small, cylindrical devices that can be affixed to a droid in order to limit its functions and enforce its obedience. When inserted, a restraining bolt restricts the droid from any movement its master does not desire, and also forced it to respond to signals produced by a hand-held control unit.

Installing a restraining bolt takes 1 minute. The droid must make a DC 24 Constitution saving throw. A hostile droid makes this save with advantage. On a successful save, the restraining bolt overloads and is rendered useless. On a failed save, the restraining bolt is correctly installed, and the control unit can be used to actively control the droid. While the control unit is inactive, the droid can act freely but it can not attempt to remove the restraining bolt.

item.name: Retrosaber
entries: The retrosaber is an ancient type of lightweapon that requires a power cell to function. Once four attacks have been made with a retrosaber, a character must replace the power cell using an action or bonus action. You must have one free hand to replace the power cell.

item.name: Returning Weapon Guard
entries: This weapon gains the returning property.

item.name: Returning Weapon Hilt
entries: This weapon gains the returning property.

item.name: Reverse-Engineered Crushgaunts
entries: Your Strength score is 19 while you wear these gauntlets. They have no effect on you if your Strength is already 19 or higher.
{@i Though the knowledge to forge a pair of true} shuk'orok {@i is a closely-guarded Mandalorian secret, the effects of these gloves are desirable enough to spawn numerous imitators.}

item.name: Ring of Adept Force Storing
entries: This ring stores force powers cast into it, holding them until the attuned wearer uses them. The ring can store up to 6 levels worth of force powers at a time. When found, it contains {@dice 1d7 - 1} levels of stored force powers chosen by the GM.

Any creature can cast a force power of 1st through 6th level into the ring by touching the ring as the force power is cast. The force power has no effect, other than to be stored in the ring. If the ring can't hold the force power, the force power is expended without effect. The level of the slot used to cast the force power determines how much space it uses.

While wearing this ring, you can cast any force power stored in it. The force power uses the slot level, force save DC, force attack bonus, and forcecasting ability of the original caster, but is otherwise treated as if you cast the force power. The force power cast from the ring is no longer stored in it, freeing up space.

item.name: Ring of Master Force Storing
entries: This ring stores force powers cast into it, holding them until the attuned wearer uses them. The ring can store up to 8 levels worth of force powers at a time. When found, it contains {@dice 1d9 - 1} levels of stored force powers chosen by the GM.

Any creature can cast a force power of 1st through 8th level into the ring by touching the ring as the force power is cast. The force power has no effect, other than to be stored in the ring. If the ring can't hold the force power, the force power is expended without effect. The level of the slot used to cast the force power determines how much space it uses.

While wearing this ring, you can cast any force power stored in it. The force power uses the slot level, force save DC, force attack bonus, and forcecasting ability of the original caster, but is otherwise treated as if you cast the force power. The force power cast from the ring is no longer stored in it, freeing up space.

item.name: Rocket Boots (Champion)
entries: Rocket boots are a form of rocket propulsion system affixed to a pair of boots instead of being worn on the back like a standard jetpack. Activating or deactivating the boots requires a bonus action and, while active, you have a flying speed of 50 feet. The rocket boots last for 1 minute and can be recharged by a power source or replacing the power cell.

item.name: Rocket, Fragmentation (Average)
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with this enhanced rocket launcher ammunition, which deals {@damage 2d6} kinetic damage on a hit. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the rocket is fired, it no longer gives a bonus. Additionally, hit or miss, the rocket then explodes. The target and each creature within 15 feet must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 4d10} kinetic damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.

entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack rolls made with this enhanced rocket launcher ammunition, which deals {@damage 2d6} kinetic damage on a hit. item.name: Rocketpack
entries: Rocketpacks combine the aerial transportation of a jetpack with the firepower of a rocket launcher. Activating or deactivating the rocketpack's flight capabilities requires a bonus action and, while active, you have a flying speed of 25 feet. The jetpack last for 1 minute per power cell (to a maximum of 5 minutes) and can be recharged by a power source or replacing the power cells.

Additionally, your rocketpack comes with an integrated rocket launcher with the Ammunition (range 100/400) and reload 1 properties. Rather than traditional power cells, this rocket launcher fires specialized projectiles in the form of rockets. Whenever you would make a ranged weapon attack, you can instead fire this rocket launcher. When firing a rocket at long range, creatures within the radius of the rocket's explosion have advantage on the saving throw. Reloading this rocket launcher takes 1 minute.

Additionally, your rocketpack comes with an enhanced integrated rocket launcher with the Ammunition (range 100/400) and reload 1 properties.
