item.name: Rylith Power Core
entries: When you take the {@action Attack} action and hit a target with a ranged attack with this weapon, you can repeat the attack against another creature up to 15 feet from the target in a direct line from you (no action required). Once you've used this feature, you must complete a short or long rest before you can use it again.

item.name: Sack
entries: A sack stores 30 ounces, not exceeding 1 cubic foot.

item.name: Scholar Defensive Augment
entries: You learn an additional discovery. When you complete a long rest, you can change this discovery for a different option available to you.

item.name: Scholar Offensive Augment
entries: You learn an additional maneuver, and you gain one additional superiority die.

item.name: Scout Defensive Augment
entries: You learn an additional Scout Routine option, and the radius of your Scout Routines increases by 5 feet.

item.name: Scout Offensive Augment
entries: You can apply the additional damage from your Ranger's Quarry feature one additional time per turn.

item.name: Security Spike (Champion)
entries: When you make an Intelligence ({@skill security kit|orcnogSW5e}) check, you can use the spike (no action required) to gain advantage on the check, and then you can reroll both of the dice once. You can wait until after you roll the {@dice d20} before deciding to use the spike, but you must decide before the GM says whether the check succeeds or fails.

item.name: Security Spike (Fine)
entries: When you make an Intelligence ({@skill security kit|orcnogSW5e}) check, you can use the spike (no action required) to gain advantage on the check. You can wait until after you roll the {@dice d20} before deciding to use the spike, but you must decide before the GM says whether the check succeeds or fails.

item.name: Security Spike (Superior)
entries: When you make an Intelligence ({@skill security kit|orcnogSW5e}) check, you can use the spike (no action required) to gain advantage on the check, and then you can reroll one of the dice once. You can wait until after you roll the {@dice d20} before deciding to use the spike, but you must decide before the GM says whether the check succeeds or fails.

item.name: Security kit
entries: Security kits are used to bypass physical locks.

item.name: Security spike
entries: When you make an Intelligence ({@skill security kit|orcnogSW5e}) check, you can use the spike (no action required) to reroll the check. You must use the new roll. You can wait until after you roll the {@dice d20} before deciding to use the spike, but you must decide before the GM says whether the check succeeds or fails.

item.name: Semiauto Core
entries: This weapon loses the auto property.

item.name: Sentinel Defensive Augment
entries: You gain an additional manifestation use of your Sentinel Ideals.

item.name: Sentinel Offensive Augment
entries: You learn an additional Sentinel Ideal option.

item.name: Sentry
entries: You learn the {@spell alarm|orcnogSW5e} tech power. You can cast it once, without the use of a wristpad and without spending tech points, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Intelligence is your techcasting ability for this power.
{@i This part equips a droid with a small rotating sensory dish.}

item.name: Sentry Gun
entries: Before firing the sentry gun, you must deploy it using an action unless you meet its strength requirement. Alternatively, if you're able to make multiple attacks with the {@action Attack} action, this action replaces one of them.  While deployed in this way, you treat this weapon's strength number as two steps less (from 19 to 15), your speed is reduced by half, and you cannot fire this weapon at long range. You can collapse the sentry gun as an action or bonus action.

item.name: Serrated Edge Mk I
entries: When you deal damage with this weapon, you can roll a {@dice d4} and add the result to the total.

item.name: Serrated Edge Mk II
entries: When you deal damage with this weapon, you can roll a {@dice d6} and add the result to the total.

item.name: Serrated Edge Mk III
entries: When you deal damage with this weapon, you can roll a {@dice d8} and add the result to the total.

item.name: Serrated Edge Mk IV
entries: When you deal damage with this weapon, you can roll a {@dice d10} and add the result to the total.

item.name: Shield (Champion)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to AC while wielding this shield. Additionally, while wielding this shield, damage you take is reduced by 2. If this would reduce the damage to 0, the damage is instead reduced to 1.

item.name: Shield (Exceptional)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to AC while wielding this shield. Additionally, while wielding this shield, damage you take is reduced by 1. If this would reduce the damage to 0, the damage is instead reduced to 1.

item.name: Shield (Fine)
entries: You have a +1 bonus to AC while wielding this shield.

item.name: Shield (Improved)
entries: You have a +2 bonus to AC while wielding this shield.

item.name: Shield (Superior)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to AC while wielding this shield.

item.name: Shield Amplifier
entries: You modify this shield generator to project outward. As a bonus action you can amplify this shield until the start of your next turn. Each creature within 5 feet of you gains a bonus to AC equal to this shield's bonus.
You can use this feature twice. You regain all expended uses when you complete a short or long rest.

item.name: Shield Anchor
entries: This shield gains the anchor property.

item.name: Shield Chassis (Advanced)
entries: This modifiable shield chassis comes with vacant modification slots for armor modifications, as well as one augment slot. It can house modifications of advanced rarity or lower.

item.name: Shield Chassis (Artifact)
entries: This modifiable shield chassis comes with vacant modification slots for armor modifications, as well as two augment slots. It can house modifications of artifact rarity or lower.

item.name: Shield Chassis (Legendary)
entries: This modifiable shield chassis comes with vacant modification slots for armor modifications, as well as two augment slots. It can house modifications of legendary rarity or lower.

item.name: Shield Chassis (Premium)
entries: This modifiable shield chassis comes with vacant modification slots for armor modifications. It can house modifications of premium rarity or lower.

item.name: Shield Chassis (Prototype)
entries: This modifiable shield chassis comes with vacant modification slots for armor modifications, as well as one augment slot. It can house modifications of prototype rarity or lower.

item.name: Shield Chassis (Standard)
entries: This modifiable shield chassis comes with vacant modification slots for armor modifications. It can house modifications of standard rarity.

item.name: Ship Armor (Fine)
entries: Your ship has a +1 bonus to AC while this armor is installed.

item.name: Ship Armor (Improved)
entries: Your ship has a +2 bonus to AC while this armor is installed.

item.name: Ship Armor (Superior)
entries: Your ship has a +3 bonus to AC while this armor is installed.

item.name: Ship Shield (Fine)
entries: Your ship has a +1 bonus to Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws while this shield is installed.

item.name: Ship Shield (Improved)
entries: Your ship has a +2 bonus to Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws while this shield is installed.

item.name: Ship Shield (Superior)
entries: Your ship has a +3 bonus to Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws while this shield is installed.

item.name: Ship Weapon (Fine)
entries: Your ship has a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced ship weapon.

item.name: Ship Weapon (Improved)
entries: Your ship has a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced ship weapon.

item.name: Ship Weapon (Superior)
entries: Your ship has a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced ship weapon.

item.name: Shock Arm
entries: You have a small integrated droid shock arm with which you can make unarmed strikes. You have proficiency in this shock arm, which is a vibroweapon with the reach property and deals {@damage 1d6} lightning damage on a hit. You can use your choice of Strength or Intelligence for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls.
{@i This small robotic appendage has a fork-like prod from that can release a substantial electrical discharge.}

item.name: Shock gloves
entries: A shock glove is a type of armored glove that is coated with a webbed lacing. When used for an attack, this webbing carries a charge that deals {@damage 1d4} lightning damage to any objects that the glove come in contact with. If you are engaged in combat with the target of the attack, you must make a grapple check instead of an attack roll, using a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check contested by the target's Strength ({@skill Athletics}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check (the target chooses the ability to use).

item.name: Shocking Oscillator
entries: This weapon gains the shocking 13 property. If it already has the shocking property, its shocking number increases by 1, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Shocking Oscillator Mk II
entries: This weapon gains the shocking 14 property. If it already has the shocking property, its shocking number increases by 2, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Shocking Oscillator Mk III
entries: This weapon gains the shocking 15 property. If it already has the shocking property, its shocking number increases by 3, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Shocking Oscillator Mk IV
entries: This weapon gains the shocking 16 property. If it already has the shocking property, its shocking number increases by 4, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Shocking Oscillator Mk V
entries: This weapon gains the shocking 17 property. If it already has the shocking property, its shocking number increases by 5, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Shocking Oscillator Mk VI
entries: This weapon gains the shocking 18 property. If it already has the shocking property, its shocking number increases to 18.

item.name: Shortbow
entries: Rather than traditional power cells, the shortbow fires specialized projectiles in the form of arrows. You can make a ranged weapon attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one arrow.

Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

item.name: Shotgun Axe
entries: You have a +1 to damage rolls made with this shotgun. Additionally, this shotgun has an axe attachment, allowing you to make a melee weapon attack with it. The axe is a melee weapon that you are proficient with, and deals {@damage 1d8} kinetic damage.
Additionally, when you use this shotgun as an improvised weapon, you are considered proficient in it, and it deals {@damage 1d8} kinetic damage on a hit.
{@i "Oh you want clever? Come a little closer, I'll get real clever."}

item.name: Shoulder Blaster
entries: Mounted by the shoulder slot, a shoulder blaster does not require a free hand to use. Additionally, you have advantage on Strength ability checks and saving throws to avoid being disarmed of this weapon.

item.name: Shoulder Cannon
entries: Mounted by the shoulder slot, a shoulder cannon does not require a free hand to use. Additionally, you have advantage on Strength ability checks and saving throws to avoid being disarmed of this weapon.

item.name: Shoulder Cannon (Champion)
entries: Mounted in the shoulder slot, a shoulder cannon does not require a free hand to use. Additionally, you have advantage on Strength ability checks and saving throws to avoid being disarmed of this weapon. You have a +3 bonus to attack rolls and deal an additional {@damage 1d10} damage with this enhanced shoulder cannon, which has the smart (20, +6) property.

item.name: Shoulder Cannon (Exceptional)
entries: Mounted in the shoulder slot, a shoulder cannon does not require a free hand to use. Additionally, you have advantage on Strength ability checks and saving throws to avoid being disarmed of this weapon. You have a +3 bonus to attack rolls and deal an additional {@damage 1d8} damage with this enhanced shoulder cannon, which has the smart (19, +5) property.

item.name: Shoulder Cannon (Fine)
entries: Mounted in the shoulder slot, a shoulder cannon does not require a free hand to use. Additionally, you have advantage on Strength ability checks and saving throws to avoid being disarmed of this weapon. You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced shoulder cannon, which has the smart (16, +2) property.

item.name: Shoulder Cannon (Improved)
entries: Mounted in the shoulder slot, a shoulder cannon does not require a free hand to use. Additionally, you have advantage on Strength ability checks and saving throws to avoid being disarmed of this weapon. You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced shoulder cannon, which has the smart (17, +3) property.

item.name: Shoulder Cannon (Superior)
entries: Mounted in the shoulder slot, a shoulder cannon does not require a free hand to use. Additionally, you have advantage on Strength ability checks and saving throws to avoid being disarmed of this weapon. You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced shoulder cannon, which has the smart (18, +4) property.

item.name: Siege Weapon
entries: You modify this weapon to be more effective against barriers. The weapon deals double damage against structures.

item.name: Sienar Starfire X-Force Mk I
entries: When you spend tech points to cast a tech power that restores hit points to a creature, the creature gains a number of temporary hit points equal to the number of tech points spent.

item.name: Sienar Starfire X-Force Mk II
entries: When you spend tech points to cast a tech power that restores hit points to a creature, the creature gains a number of temporary hit points equal to twice the number of tech points spent.

item.name: Silencer
entries: This weapon gains the silent property.

item.name: Silent Armoring
entries: This armor gains the silent property.

item.name: Silver-Tongued Pattern (Basic)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Deception} increases by one step (to trained, from trained to proficient, from proficient to expertise, from expertise to mastery, from mastery to high mastery, or from high mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Silver-Tongued Pattern (Choice)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Deception} increases by four steps (to mastery, from trained to high mastery, or from proficient to grand mastery).

item.name: Silver-Tongued Pattern (Elite)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Deception} increases by five steps (to high mastery or from trained to grand mastery).

item.name: Silver-Tongued Pattern (Exquisite)
entries: You gain grand mastery in {@skill Deception}.

item.name: Silver-Tongued Pattern (Favored)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Deception} increases by three steps (to expertise, from trained to mastery, from proficient to high mastery, or from expertise to grand mastery).

item.name: Silver-Tongued Pattern (Fine)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Deception} increases by two steps (to proficient, from trained to expertise, from proficient to mastery, from expertise to high mastery, or from mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Sith Acolyte's Robe
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to damage rolls with weapons and force powers while you wear this robe.
{@i Designed for those who relish personal combat, and know that power comes to those who take it, these robes augment offensive capabilities with no hindrance to movement.}

item.name: Sith Lord's Robe
entries: You gain a +3 bonus to damage rolls with weapons and force powers while you wear this robe.
{@i Designed for those who relish personal combat, and know that power comes to those who take it, these robes masterfully augment offensive capabilities with no hindrance to movement.}

item.name: Sith Strength Belt
entries: While wearing this belt, your Strength score becomes 27. If your Strength is already equal to or greater than 27, it has no effect on you.

{@i Worn on the legs, waist and lower back, this belt massively increases a users physical power with a set of heavy durasteel actuators alongside an synaptic monitoring system that reacts to its users motion with optimized power responses.}

item.name: Sith Warrior's Robe
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with weapons and force powers while you wear this robe.
{@i Designed for those who relish personal combat, and know that power comes to those who take it, these robes greatly augment offensive capabilities with no hindrance to movement.}

item.name: Skills Enhancement Package
entries: When you make an ability check using a skill you are proficient in, you can roll a {@dice d4} and add the result to your total.
{@b Side Effect:} When you make an ability check using a skill you are not proficient in, you must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the result from the total.
{@i This implant includes a library of situational information that it injects directly into your consciousness.}

item.name: Slicer's kit
entries: Slicer's kits can bypass computerized defenses and locks.

item.name: Slipstream Kickers
entries: While you wear these boots, you can use a bonus action to activate or deactivate their overdrive mode. If you do, you gain the effect of the {@spell tactical advantage|orcnogSW5e} tech power for 1 minute. Once you've used this feature, you must complete a long rest before you can use it again.

item.name: Slug Cartridge (Average)
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced slug cartridge. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the slug cartridge has been fired, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Slug Cartridge (Deadly)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced slug cartridge. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the slug cartridge has been fired, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Slug Cartridge (Devastating)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack rolls and deal an additional {@damage 1d10} damage with this enhanced slug cartridge. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the slug cartridge has been fired, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Slug Cartridge (Lethal)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack rolls and deal an additional {@damage 1d8} damage with this enhanced slug cartridge. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the slug cartridge has been fired, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Slug Cartridge (Major)
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced slug cartridge. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the slug cartridge has been fired, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Slug cartridge
entries: Weapons with this property fire slug cartridges, which must be loaded in order to fire the weapon.

item.name: Smart Interface (Basic)
entries: This weapon gains the smart (15, +2) property. If it already has the smart property, its smart numbers increase by +1 and +1, respectively, to a maximum of 20 and +6.

item.name: Smart Interface (Champion)
entries: This weapon gains the smart (20, +6) property. If it already has the smart property, its smart numbers increase to 20 and +6, respectively.

item.name: Smart Interface (Exceptional)
entries: This weapon gains the smart (19, +5) property. If it already has the smart property, its smart numbers increase by +5 and +4, respectively, to a maximum of 20 and +6.

item.name: Smart Interface (Fine)
entries: This weapon gains the smart (16, +2) property. If it already has the smart property, its smart numbers increase by +2 and +1, respectively, to a maximum of 20 and +6.

item.name: Smart Interface (Improved)
entries: This weapon gains the smart (17, +3) property. If it already has the smart property, its smart numbers increase by +3 and +2, respectively, to a maximum of 20 and +6.

item.name: Smart Interface (Superior)
entries: This weapon gains the smart (18, +4) property. If it already has the smart property, its smart numbers increase by +4 and +3, respectively, to a maximum of 20 and +6.

item.name: Smugglepack
entries: This backpack comes with a main compartment that stores 15.00 lb., not exceeding 1/2 cubic foot. Additionally, it has a hidden storage compartment that stores 5 lb., not exceeding 1/4 cubic foot. Finding the hidden compartment requires a DC 15 {@skill Investigation} check.

item.name: Smugglepack (Champion)
entries: This backpack comes with a main compartment that stores 10 lb., not exceeding 1/2 cubic foot. Additionally, it has a hidden storage compartment that stores 10 lb., not exceeding 3/8 cubic foot. Finding the hidden compartment requires a DC 30 {@skill Investigation} check.

item.name: Smugglepack (Exceptional)
entries: This backpack comes with a main compartment that stores 11 lb., not exceeding 3/8 cubic foot. Additionally, it has a hidden storage compartment that stores 9 lb., not exceeding 3/8 cubic foot. Finding the hidden compartment requires a DC 27 {@skill Investigation} check.

item.name: Smugglepack (Fine)
entries: This backpack comes with a main compartment that stores 14 lb., not exceeding 1/2 cubic foot. Additionally, it has a hidden storage compartment that stores 6 lb., not exceeding 1/4 cubic foot. Finding the hidden compartment requires a DC 18 {@skill Investigation} check.

item.name: Smugglepack (Improved)
entries: This backpack comes with a main compartment that stores 13 lb., not exceeding 1/2 cubic foot. Additionally, it has a hidden storage compartment that stores 7 lb., not exceeding 1/4 cubic foot. Finding the hidden compartment requires a DC 21 {@skill Investigation} check.

item.name: Smugglepack (Superior)
entries: This backpack comes with a main compartment that stores 12 lb., not exceeding 3/8 cubic foot. Additionally, it has a hidden storage compartment that stores 8 lb., not exceeding 3/8 cubic foot. Finding the hidden compartment requires a DC 24 {@skill Investigation} check.

item.name: Snare
entries: When hit by this wrist launcher ammunition, a Medium or smaller creature is {@condition restrained} until it is freed. A snare has no effect on formless or Large or larger creatures. A creature can use its action to make a DC 13 Strength or Dexterity check (the target chooses the ability to use), freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. The snare has an AC of 10, 5 hit points, and immunity to all damage not dealt by melee weapons. Destroying the snare frees the creature without harming it and immediately ends the snare's effects.

item.name: Snare (Champion)
entries: When hit by this wrist launcher ammunition, a Medium or smaller creature is {@condition restrained} until it is freed. A snare has no effect on formless or Large or larger creatures. A creature can use its action to make a DC 18 Strength or Dexterity check (the target chooses the ability to use), freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. The snare has an AC of 15, 30 hit points, immunity to all damage not dealt by melee weapons, and resistance to damage dealt by unenhanced melee weapons. Destroying the snare frees the creature without harming it and immediately ends the snare's effects.

item.name: Snare (Exceptional)
entries: When hit by this wrist launcher ammunition, a Medium or smaller creature is {@condition restrained} until it is freed. A snare has no effect on formless or Large or larger creatures. A creature can use its action to make a DC 18 Strength or Dexterity check (the target chooses the ability to use), freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. The snare has an AC of 14, 25 hit points, immunity to all damage not dealt by melee weapons, and resistance to damage dealt by unenhanced melee weapons. Destroying the snare frees the creature without harming it and immediately ends the snare's effects.

item.name: Snare (Fine)
entries: When hit by this wrist launcher ammunition, a Medium or smaller creature is {@condition restrained} until it is freed. A snare has no effect on formless or Large or larger creatures. A creature can use its action to make a DC 14 Strength or Dexterity check (the target chooses the ability to use), freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. The snare has an AC of 11, 10 hit points, immunity to all damage not dealt by melee weapons, and resistance to damage dealt by unenhanced melee weapons. Destroying the snare frees the creature without harming it and immediately ends the snare's effects.

item.name: Snare (Improved)
entries: When hit by this wrist launcher ammunition, a Medium or smaller creature is {@condition restrained} until it is freed. A snare has no effect on formless or Large or larger creatures. A creature can use its action to make a DC 16 Strength or Dexterity check (the target chooses the ability to use), freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. The snare has an AC of 12, 15 hit points, immunity to all damage not dealt by melee weapons, and resistance to damage dealt by unenhanced melee weapons. Destroying the snare frees the creature without harming it and immediately ends the snare's effects.

item.name: Snare (Superior)
entries: When hit by this wrist launcher ammunition, a Medium or smaller creature is {@condition restrained} until it is freed. A snare has no effect on formless or Large or larger creatures. A creature can use its action to make a DC 16 Strength or Dexterity check (the target chooses the ability to use), freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. The snare has an AC of 13, 20 hit points, immunity to all damage not dealt by melee weapons, and resistance to damage dealt by unenhanced melee weapons. Destroying the snare frees the creature without harming it and immediately ends the snare's effects.

item.name: Sonorous Oscillator
entries: This weapon gains the sonorous 13 property. If it already has the sonorous property, its sonorous number increases by 1, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Sonorous Oscillator Mk II
entries: This weapon gains the sonorous 14 property. If it already has the sonorous property, its sonorous number increases by 2, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Sonorous Oscillator Mk III
entries: This weapon gains the sonorous 15 property. If it already has the sonorous property, its sonorous number increases by 3, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Sonorous Oscillator Mk IV
entries: This weapon gains the sonorous 16 property. If it already has the sonorous property, its sonorous number increases by 4, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Sonorous Oscillator Mk V
entries: This weapon gains the sonorous 17 property. If it already has the sonorous property, its sonorous number increases by 5, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Sonorous Oscillator Mk VI
entries: This weapon gains the sonorous 18 property. If it already has the sonorous property, its sonorous number increases to 18.

item.name: Sorcerer's Adrenal (Basic)
entries: As an action, you can administer this adrenal to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, the target gains a +1 bonus to its damage and healing rolls with force powers. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one adrenal at a time.

item.name: Sorcerer's Adrenal (Fine)
entries: As an action, you can administer this adrenal to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, the target gains a +1 bonus to its force attack rolls, force save DC, and damage and healing rolls with force powers. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one adrenal at a time.

item.name: Sorcerer's Adrenal (Improved)
entries: As an action, you can administer this adrenal to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, the target gains a +2 bonus to its force attack rolls, force save DC, and damage and healing rolls with force powers. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one adrenal at a time.

item.name: Sorcerer's Adrenal (Superior)
entries: As an action, you can administer this adrenal to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, the target gains a +3 bonus to its force attack rolls, force save DC, and damage and healing rolls with force powers. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one adrenal at a time.

item.name: Sparkles
entries: When you roll a 20 on an attack roll with this weapon, or hit a creature that has not yet acted during your first turn in combat, you deal an additional {@damage 1d4} energy damage.
{@i Sparkles is a BlasTech CS-14 light pistol owned by the mercenary Corso Riggs during the Galactic Cold War.}

item.name: Spicebrew
entries: Spicebrew, a popular drink across the galaxy, is a tanned alcoholic beverage topped with foam. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next minute, the creature experiences a high that increases their current and maximum force points by {@dice 2d3}. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 10 minutes, their current and maximum force points are reduced by {@dice 2d3}. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Spicebrew (Aged)
entries: Spicebrew, a popular drink across the galaxy, is a tanned alcoholic beverage topped with foam. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next 10 minutes, the creature experiences a high that increases their current and maximum force points by {@dice 2d8}. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 4 hours, their current and maximum force points are reduced by {@dice 2d8}. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Spicebrew (Fine)
entries: Spicebrew, a popular drink across the galaxy, is a tanned alcoholic beverage topped with foam. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next minute, the creature experiences a high that increases their current and maximum force points by {@dice 2d4}. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 1 hour, their current and maximum force points are reduced by {@dice 2d4}. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Spicebrew (Matured)
entries: Spicebrew, a popular drink across the galaxy, is a tanned alcoholic beverage topped with foam. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next 10 minutes, the creature experiences a high that increases their current and maximum force points by {@dice 2d6}. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 1 hour, their current and maximum force points are reduced by {@dice 2d6}. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Spicebrew (Reserve)
entries: Spicebrew, a popular drink across the galaxy, is a tanned alcoholic beverage topped with foam. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next hour, the creature experiences a high that increases their current and maximum force points by {@dice 2d10}. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 22 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 4 hours, their current and maximum force points are reduced by {@dice 2d10}. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 22 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Spicebrew (Special)
entries: Spicebrew, a popular drink across the galaxy, is a tanned alcoholic beverage topped with foam. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next hour, the creature experiences a high that increases their current and maximum force points by {@dice 2d12}. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 24 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 8 hours, their current and maximum force points are reduced by {@dice 2d12}. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 24 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Spiked Shielding
entries: {@i {@b Prerequiste:} Shield}
This shield gains the spiked ({@dice 1d4}) property. If it already has the spiked property, the spiked damage increases by one step (from {@dice d4} to {@dice d6}, or from {@dice d6} to {@dice d8}).

item.name: Spiked Shielding Mk II
entries: {@i {@b Prerequiste:} Shield}
This shield gains the spiked ({@dice 1d6}) property. If it already has the spiked property, the spiked damage increases by two steps (from {@dice d4} to {@dice d8}).

item.name: Spiked Shielding Mk III
entries: {@i {@b Prerequiste:} Shield}
This shield gains the spiked ({@dice 1d8}) property. If it already has the spiked property, the spiked damage increases to {@dice d8}.

item.name: Stabilizer Ascendancy Cell
entries: This weapon loses the dexterity property.

item.name: Stabilizer Dueling Cell
entries: This weapon's dexterity number is reduced by three steps (from 21 to 15, 19 to 13, or 17 to 11). If the dexterity number is 15 or lower, this modification removes the dexterity property from it entirely.

item.name: Stabilizer Fighting Cell
entries: This weapon's dexterity number is reduced by two steps (from 21 to 17, 19 to 15, 17 to 13, or 15 to 11). If the dexterity number is 13 or lower, this modification removes the dexterity property from it entirely.

item.name: Stabilizer Mastery Cell
entries: This weapon's dexterity number is reduced by four steps (from 21 to 13 or 19 to 11). If the dexterity number is 17 or lower, this modification removes the dexterity property from it entirely.

item.name: Stabilizer Supremacy Cell
entries: This weapon's dexterity number is reduced by five steps (from 21 to 11). If the dexterity number is 19 or lower, this modification removes the dexterity property from it entirely.

item.name: Stabilizer Training Cell
entries: This weapon's dexterity number is reduced by one step (from 21 to 19, 19 to 17, 17 to 15, 15 to 13, or 13 to 11). If the dexterity number is 11, this modification removes the dexterity property from it entirely.

item.name: Staggering Oscillator
entries: When you hit with the weapon, you can force the target to make a DC 13 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is pushed back 10 feet and knocked {@condition prone}.
Once you've used this feature, you must complete a short or long rest before you can use it again.

item.name: Stamina Adrenal (Basic)
entries: As an action, you can administer this adrenal to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, the target's current and maximum hit points increase by 10. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one adrenal at a time.

item.name: Stamina Adrenal (Champion)
entries: As an action, you can administer this adrenal to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, the target's current and maximum hit points increase by 60. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one adrenal at a time.

item.name: Stamina Adrenal (Exceptional)
entries: As an action, you can administer this adrenal to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, the target's current and maximum hit points increase by 50. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one adrenal at a time.

item.name: Stamina Adrenal (Fine)
entries: As an action, you can administer this adrenal to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, the target's current and maximum hit points increase by 20. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one adrenal at a time.

item.name: Stamina Adrenal (Improved)
entries: As an action, you can administer this adrenal to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, the target's current and maximum hit points increase by 30. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one adrenal at a time.

item.name: Stamina Adrenal (Superior)
entries: As an action, you can administer this adrenal to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, the target's current and maximum hit points increase by 40. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one adrenal at a time.

item.name: Steadfast Reinforcement
entries: This armor or shield gains the steadfast property.

item.name: Stealth field generator
entries: {@skill Stealth} field generators are special devices typically worn on belts that function as a portable, personal cloaking device. Activating or deactivating the generator requires a bonus action and, while active, you have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) ability checks that rely on sight. The generator lasts for 1 minute and can be recharged by a power source or replacing the power cell. This effect ends early if you make an attack or cast a force- or tech- power.

item.name: Stealthy Pattern (Basic)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Stealth} increases by one step (to trained, from trained to proficient, from proficient to expertise, from expertise to mastery, from mastery to high mastery, or from high mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Stealthy Pattern (Choice)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Stealth} increases by four steps (to mastery, from trained to high mastery, or from proficient to grand mastery).

item.name: Stealthy Pattern (Elite)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Stealth} increases by five steps (to high mastery or from trained to grand mastery).

item.name: Stealthy Pattern (Exquisite)
entries: You gain grand mastery in {@skill Stealth}.

item.name: Stealthy Pattern (Favored)

item.name: Strength Stim (Basic)

item.name: Sunshades
entries: These shades are worn over the eyes. While worn, you can no longer have disadvantage due to direct sunlight on attack rolls and on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight. However, while worn, you have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in dim light.

item.name: Surveillance Implant
entries: This augmentation replaces your face.
This implant includes a @{item headcomm|orcnogSW5e} with a scrambler that automatically encodes messages sent to a specified recipient @{item commlink|orcnogSW5e} or receiver.

{@b Side Effect:} You can not use portable personal devices used for communication or jamming, such as a @{item commlink|orcnogSW5e} or @{item holotrace device|orcnogSW5e}, due to interference with this implant.
{@i This augmentation appears as a crescent around one eye paired with two small dots above the eyebrow.}

item.name: Survival and Surveillance Implant
entries: This augmentation replaces your eyes and face.

This implant contains several tools for long-term survival and reconnaissance. As a bonus action, you can activate one of the below modes that enable you to use several of these tools at once. Only one mode can be active at a time.

items: {@b Communications Mode:} This communications suite includes a @{item headcomm|orcnogSW5e} with a scrambler that automatically encodes messages sent to a specified recipient @{item commlink|orcnogSW5e} or receiver. While this mode is active, you cannot be {@condition deafened}.
{@b Interceptor Mode:} This is a jamming and electronic warfare suite that includes a @{item comm jammer|orcnogSW5e}, a @{item holotrace device|orcnogSW5e} and {@item pocket scrambler|orcnogSW5e}.
{@b Respirator Mode:} This includes a basic {@item respirator|orcnogSW5e} that grants advantage on saving throws made to avoid being {@condition poisoned} and resistance to poison damage.

entries: {@b Side Effect:} This complex interface causes significant interference with other communication devices, rendering them impossible to use. While this implant is installed, you can not use any portable device used for communication or jamming, such as a @{item commlink|orcnogSW5e} or @{item holotrace device|orcnogSW5e}.

{@i Frequently used by scouts and corporate espionage specialists, this imposing implant covers nearly the entire left half of the face, and includes a series of tools for long-term survival in hostile conditions.}

item.name: Survival and Surveillance Implant Mk II
entries: This augmentation replaces your eyes and face.

This implant contains several improved tools for long-term survival and reconnaissance. As a bonus action, you can activate one of the below modes that enable you to use several of these tools at once. Only one mode can be active at a time.

items: {@b Communications Mode:} This communications suite includes a @{item headcomm|orcnogSW5e} with a scrambler that automatically encodes messages sent to a specified recipient @{item commlink|orcnogSW5e} or receiver. While this mode is active, you cannot be {@condition deafened}. Additionally, if you listen to any spoken language for 10 minutes, the software in this package will begin to attempt to decipher it. Make an Intelligence ({@skill Lore}) check, DC determined by the GM depending on the rarity of the language. On a success, you can understand the spoken form of this language, and speak it if your species' vocal capabilities allow for it.

{@b Interceptor Mode:} This is a jamming and electronic warfare suite that includes a @{item comm jammer|orcnogSW5e}, a @{item holotrace device|orcnogSW5e} and pocket scrambler. Additionally, you can attempt to listen in on nearby audio communications chatter such as from a @{item commlink|orcnogSW5e} or {@item holocomm|orcnogSW5e} as an action. Make an Intelligence ({@skill Technology}) check, DC determined by the GM depending on the sophistication of the technology. On a success, you can hear electronic communications originating from within 100 feet.

{@b Respirator Mode:} This includes a basic {@item respirator|orcnogSW5e} that grants advantage on saving throws made to avoid being {@condition poisoned} and resistance to poison damage. Additionally, you do not need air to breathe, allowing you to survive even in vacuum for up to 1 hour.

entries: {@b Side Effect:} This complex interface causes significant interference with other communication devices, rendering them impossible to use. While this implant is installed, you can not use any portable device used for communication or jamming, such as a @{item commlink|orcnogSW5e} or @{item holotrace device|orcnogSW5e}.
{@i This sleek, stark white device adorned with a small antenna attaches to the back of the otherwise bulky S3 module.}

item.name: Thermal Detonator (Average)
entries: Thermal detonators are unique in that can only be turned off by whoever turned them on. They can be set to detonate on impact or with a timer that causes them to explode on initiative count 20 (losing all initiative ties). As an action, you can prime and throw a grenade at a point you can see within 30 feet + your Strength modifier x 5. Each creature within 20 feet must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@dice 4d6} fire and {@damage 4d10} kinetic damage on a failed save, or half as much as on a successful one. Additionally, on a failed save, the creature is knocked {@condition prone}.

item.name: Tihaar
entries: This colorless spirit, favored by Mandalorians, burns the mouth and throat when consumed. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next minute, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d3} when making an ability check or saving throw using Constitution, and at the start of each of the creature's turns it gains {@dice 2d3} temporary hit points. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 10 minutes, during which they must roll a {@dice d3} and subtract the result when making an ability check or saving throw using Constitution, and for the duration their current and maximum hit points are reduced by {@dice 2d3}. If this would reduce your maximum hit points below 1, it instead becomes 1. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.
